Reviews.Title: “The Rosedale could be rosier”
Reviews.Author: natshats
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers great front desk help and always offers a fresh and delicious continental breakfast. The rooms are however getting old: the beds are short and hard and need better sheets and blankets. The rooms are very clean but the bathrooms quite tight and at times short of water pressure. Although not a 5 rating, our family always chooses the Rosedale because of the convenience to places including restaurants and shopping. One can choose to cook because each suite is carefully contained with cooking essentials including an oven. It doesn't include pots and pans but hey, you are on a holiday! Each day fresh towels and kitchen towels are replaced and light cleaning is performed. You really can't beat the Rosedale when staying downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Like a mini home abroad.”
Reviews.Author: Wynona L
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located in Downtown Vancouver so public transport, tourist attractions, ATMs, and restaurants all within walking distance. This is also useful if you're embarking on a day tour, as bus drivers/ tour directors can easily find the hotel to pick you up or drop you off. Upon arriving, we were greeting by a smiling bellman who led us past the concierge to reception. If you need anything, from a map of Vancouver to hockey tickets, the concierge is the person to see. With their can-do attitude, and efficient service, it's like having a tourist information centre right there in the hotel. There are also public computers with internet access (which can be purchased from reception), and various tourist information brochures available. Checking in at reception was quick and easy, and we were soon in the elevator on the way to our room. Our room was clean and tidy, and had all be basic amenities to make it feel as if we had our own apartment. There was a kitchenette complete with basic cutlery and crockery, a phone and TV in both the living room and bedroom, and separate air conditioning units for both these rooms. Housekeeping is quick, efficient, and unobtrusive; our room was cleaned in the time it took us to have breakfast (which is also included in the price of the stay). There is also a pub called Rosie's on Robson which provides room service to the hotel until 10pm. For the cost of an average pub meal, you get filling, good tasting food in the comfort of your hotel room. Once again, the staff is friendly, and all transactions are smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3-Day Birthday Celebration!”
Reviews.Author: AbiznessDigital_16
Reviews.Content: My husband & I are timeshare owners with VI and they own several units in this building. We choose it initially because of the location - within 4 hours of our home. After considering the cost of gas & parking, we decided to take Amtrak. (There are multiple departures from the Seattle-area.) We caught the Sky Train one stop and then it was an 8 minute walk to Robson & Hamilton. Our room was on the 15th floor & we had a grand view of the city. Much of what we did was walking distance - taking the ferry to Granville Island, walking to/from Stanley park, Gas Town, eating, Sky Train, etc. Staff were helpful suggesting several places to eat. Rooms were clean & utilitarian (ours had a kitchenette & small dining area). There was a bit of street noise but nothing atrocious. We even used the Steam & Dry Sauna every day of our stay. We'll definitely be coming back again!

Reviews.Title: “On my #1 list to stay with when in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: pajim20
Reviews.Content: Been coming to this hotel for years and yes had 1 issue in the many years we have stayed here..But Managment looked after it right away .We stay at Rosedale on Robson ..for several reasons; Close to Rogers,B.C. Place and uptown.. Front Desk is great helpfull and has all the answers Rooms great big and views in every room...(never stayed close to the top but view must Be great) where do you get a room w kitchen and lounge room w hide abed @ Rosedale on Robson The pud was great food excellant and price where really good all and all everything was great. a slight wait for elevators but hey Canucks game full hotel hey Just gave me a moment to talk to other guest about the game We did not get to go for a swim so we can not rate the pool area. But I would like to say I have been a employee in the hotel motel industry for 27 years and Jim my hats off to the front desk staff and you .. very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money!”
Reviews.Author: VanIsleReview
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks nice on line, but don't be fooled. It is dated and dirty. The Staff even said that other guests had issues with the stained carpets, dirty dishes, general uncleanliness and dated decor. This hotel is an embarrassment to Avia West. It is shocking that they are affiliated with such a disgusting hotel. We would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: microdotty
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in central Vancouver, we had two queen beds, with plenty of room for luggage and to spread out. The bathroom we well appointed and clean. We had a lounge room with a kitchen. The staff were excellent with a information section downstairs. There was a supermarket on the corner, McDonalds, pharmacy, coffe place and take away and eat in restaurants close by. A restaurant in the hotel had a great menu. It also has laundry machine and dryers every second floor. We stayed here twice and recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for down town Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Carlystar
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in down town Vancouver. The room we stayed in was a 2 bedroom with lounge area and kitchen which included a coffee machine. The room was very clean and the hotel had a bar down stairs with breakfast and drinks till late, which provided free wifi for use. The bed was a bit hard for my liking. The hotel was in a great location to go to the Canucks game as the stadium was within walking distance. It was also close to Granville st and shops along robson avenue but not right in the middle to get the noise..

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay. Great for business as I was or pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: KarlosPerth
Reviews.Content: Great value. Great room and good location. Will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Matthew44
Reviews.Content: Excellent location within easy walking distance of the centre of the city. We had a good studio here with plenty of space, two TVs, fridge & cooking facilities. Good heating, and we can open the window for fresh air (I'm not a fan of air-conditioning!) Very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Price, size, location trumps decor”
Reviews.Author: valu8or
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for proximity to BC Place and convention rate. Plain living room, doll sized kitchen, rather plain bathroom and spacious bedroom. Dollar for dollar it's a good deal if you value space and an almost condo style accommodation on Robson Street in the heart of downtown Vancouver close to everything Included continental style breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading reviews”
Reviews.Author: jessica P
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews on here and thought it looked like a nice place to stay, so I booked us for all 9 nights we were in Vancouver. They gave us a discounted rate for staying so long (I think it was corporate rate) but I realized that didn't include wifi so I called and they comped the internet since we'd be staying so long. When we arrived we were told that only one device was covered for wifi and it would be an additional $15/day per device. My boyfriend does this (networks) for work, and that's the whole reason for the visit. Since I'm staying with him I need to entertain myself while he's at work and I use the internet for that. So we need at least 2 devices, and that's before our tablets and 3rd laptop. We got to the room and the internet was shotty, we had to keep putting in the password. If they are charging $15/day/device, you'd think they'd be able to afford the best of the best, highest speed internet. But after the first day, we discovered this was absolutely not the case when the internet went out. We couldn't log on at all, and when we called the desk they said "maybe it will be fixed tomorrow",, tomorrow came and it was "maybe tonight" but the bf had some coworkers coming in to join him & stay in the same hotel. We all cancelled our reservations and went to Georgian Court (which was great). They were allowing guests to use wired internet at their single kiosk for 15 minutes at a time but the line was full of angry guests...it was not pleasant waiting in line to find a new hotel. That's not all, the kitchens are from the 50's- completely metal and grimy. Our fridge wasn't working so we had to ask someone to come show us how to turn it on. Being so old it was hard to figure out the little plug in the back controls the temperature. The beds were hard, but I don't mind that usually. These were bad though. The carpets were gross & grimy and the bathroom was too small for 2 people. There were no full length mirrors and the lighting was bad. The breakfast was decent at least. Fruit, muffins coffee & tea-continental breakfast. But the exercise room was pitiful. I thought it was a storage room when we arrived, but when I went to use it, yikes. It is on the ground level, with window walls looking out to the driveway where people and taxis come & go. There were a couple of outdated machines, one was unplugged and "out of service" sign was on it. There were white stains on the curtains (I can only imagine) and what looked like vomit stains on the carpet. This would be an ok place to stay (for less money) if you were going to a game or just wanted to party and were leaving the next day. And didn't have to shower. The shower curtains are really cheap and suck in while you shower, so you have to push them out or put weights on them. This results in a flood every time you shower and there isn't enough space in the bathroom to hold all the towels you will need to use to mop up. It feels like everything in this hotel came from a garage sale. There wasn't even any stuffing left in the couch. It's gross, I would never stay here again unless it was free. Even then only maybe. At least the staff was friendly and accommodating. I almost feel bad leaving such a bad review. The owner should stop being stingy with the money you charge people and splurge on quality furniture, flooring, internet, etc. Stop buying from old estate sales.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: Leanne D
Reviews.Content: Very shocked at how they treated us. They disregarded the fact that we are paying customers wanting to stay at their hotel and instead treated us very horrible. It is a very dissappointing hotel and I would never recommed it to anyone! I am surprised they stay in buisness with the way they treat their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: timbo
Reviews.Content: I spent one night q the Rosedale on Wednesday 22 February. Nice surprise. Hotel is well located in downtown Vancouver. Suite was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. Check in and out was quick and courteous. Concierge allowed me to use his computer when the business computer was not functioning properly. My one night stay was great and I would stay again if back in Vancouver. Lots of restaurants in the area including Rosie's in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: tedcBc
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Wednesday and stayed two nights. We had a one bedroom suite for my son and I and were in town to watch the hockey game. Perfect spot to stay with easy walking distance to restaurants and to either of the stadiums (BC Place or GM Place). The parking was easy to get into and out of and the room was adequate for our needs. We were on the 10th floor so it was fairly quiet and folks at the desk were polite and helpful. It isn't a high end place but there wasn't anything that would stop me from using this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: DodieKamloops_BC
Reviews.Content: We went to Vancouver for a hockey game and stayed at the Rosedale on Robson because of the location to Rogers Arena. The decor was upscale, beds very comfortable. We had lunch and breakfast in the restaurant food and service were excellent. I would recommend this property for traveling for business or pleasure to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Tired. My partner said there were 'critters' (mice) in the walls and ceilings.”
Reviews.Author: jamesmorton
Reviews.Content: Not terrible but there are nicer places for the same price so why stay here? The rooms are small and tired. Seemed clean enough to me but maybe there are mice in the walls -- I heard something but am not sure what. Anyway, try elsewhere first.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice updated room -- VI Owner Review”
Reviews.Author: CheerMom602
Reviews.Content: I booked a girls weekend trip courtesy of VI’s bonus time for last weekend. I was a little leery after looking at some the pics on this site but our room (#809) was really nice and appeared to have been recreantly fully updated. I knew VI had redone the kitchen areas but I didn’t know what to expect regarding the rest of the unit. I was very pleasantly surprised to find that everything had fresh updated look to it. The living room/kitchen area in the two bedroom suite was definitely smaller than at other VI resorts I’ve been to (only about a fourth of the usual amount of space, if that) and with only 1 bathroom, 1 living room chair, a couch that sits 3 and a table that seats 2 in my opinion it’d be WAY too small for a party of 6 but for a party of 4 it was comfortable. The TV in the front room had horrible reception, very snowy. I reported it to VI so hopefully they’ll get that fixed. The TV in the 2nd bedroom was fine and we never tested out the other one so I don’t know what it was like. I found the beds to be firm as well but the linens seemed fine to me. The check in and out process was very quick and easy. They do a temporary security charge of $100 when you check in. It’s $5 a day for internet and $16 a day for in & out parking -VERY TIGHT spaces and was a little challenging trying to find a space our 2nd night and the tax amount was around $13 for the two nights added together. We spent Saturday walking in a huge circle around Vancouver. We checked in with the concierge and let us know the safer areas vs the maybe not so safe areas. We had a huge brownie desert in the hotel restaurant the night we arrived (big enough for at least 3 to share) and breakfast there the next day, both good experiences. One thing we noticed about Canada vs. the US was how much more expensive everything was. A $3 bottle of wine down here goes for around $13 up there just to give you an idea. Also if you use US cash in stores they exchange it at 95 cents to the dollar compared to 99 cents to the dollar at the banks and most credit card companies charge an international exchange fee except for Capital One. There’s a 7-11 right across the street and tons of Starbucks around. All alcohol (even beer and wine) is only available in liquor stores. All and all it was a great little get away spot, I’ll definitely go back again at some point.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location”
Reviews.Author: wetravellots101
Reviews.Content: We like this hotel. Have stayed there a couple of times and it is an easy walk uptown or down to Yaletown for some good restaurants. The higher floors have very good views and the bar downstairs is great for a beer and an easy meal.

Reviews.Title: “not too shabby”
Reviews.Author: bungadoo
Reviews.Content: Many people have mentioned location and its true, its an awesome spot for walking around downtown.Its also in a good neighbourhood. The rooms werent bad. i liked the size and the fact that my kids could sit in the bedroom and watch cartoons and we could sit in the small living area and watch tv as well. The decor was little bit older, but I didnt think it was dingy or icky in anyway, its just not a fancy, modern place.My only minor complaint is that the bed really wasnt too comfortable and the bedding was just regular (nothing fancy) The pool was great. The staff were friendly, check in was a breeze. Besides the location, the second best part of this hotel is the cost of parking, VERY resonable for Vancouver (16 or 17 bucks a night) Ive paid as much as $45 a night at other Vancouver hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps not”
Reviews.Author: tsbright
Reviews.Content: We had two stays here that were pre-paid well in advance. The first was an overnighter in a one bedroom "deluxe" suite. We found the living area to be a bit dark and dingy even with all of the lights on. After putting our bags in the bedroom and settling in a bit, we were surprised to find that the living area had not been cleaned after the previous occupants. The carpet had not been vacuumed and there was food, sticky thick caramel I think, smeared on two of the walls and dribbled across the carpet. These were not light unnoticable marks either; one was about 4cm wide, 20cm long and 3mm deep. Yuk. We pointed it out to the staff member who brought up the extra towels for our family (we had to call for this as there were 3 towels supplied for a party of 4). He just shrugged and said "New Years Eve, we haven't had time to repaint". There was also a wall size mirror that was broken and repaired with sticky tape. Our second stay was 4 nights in a 2 bedroom suite. I'm happy to say that the room was clean this time. The kitchenette however, was poorly equipped and made it difficult to cook anything e.g. one small pot and a small frying pan were the only cooking tools supplied in our unit that was designed to sleep up to 6 people. The fridge was small with no temperature control. Disappointingly there was no table to sit at to eat either. We made one meal and decided to eat out on the remaining nights. As others have pointed out, the location is good, with plenty of eating and shopping venues close by. But I think that if we ever go back to Vancouver, we would look at alternative accommodation. This hotel was not very good value when compared with the other self contained properties we had stayed in in other locations-even New York.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: ShopperNYC
Reviews.Content: As others have said, the location is great. Walkable to Yaletown, Chinatown, Gastown, etc. The rooms are probably larger than the average hotel room because of the separate living room area, but there was a general dinginess to the place that just made it kind of... icky. The beds had those old fashioned bed spreads that probably haven't been washed since the 70s, there were no dust ruffles on the beds so the box springs were exposed, which was weird, and everything was just dated and did not feel modern and clean. The beds were horribly uncomfortable, and that is not usually something I notice, but I felt like I was sleeping on a rock. I only stayed for one night so I tolerated it, but had my trip been longer, I would have been very unhappy. I did the continental breakfast which was ok, but nothing special: a small assortment of breads and muffins, yogurt, fruit, only 3 cereals, and coffee, juice, tea, etc. Again, for one night, it was tolerable but if I go back to Vancouver I think I'll look to stay elsewhere. FYI - Parking was an additional $13/day.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Lewy_12
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights in total, four at the beginning of our holiday then overnight two weeks later. Great location within walking distance of BC Place and Rogers Arena with Queen Elizabeth Theatre a stone's throw away. Also close to bus and train routes and not far from Gastown and Downtown generally. 7 Eleven acorss the road and Subway around the corner with a small drug store just beyond that and not too far from London Drugs so everything you need is close by. We had a one bedroom queen room and while the bathroom was on the small side, both the lounge and bedroom areas were ample. Didn't use the kitchenette to cook with but it was ideal for breakfast particularly with supplies close at hand from nearby shops. The laundry was very convenient and the indoor pool was a good size and temperature. We had an evening meal at Rosie's which was good and reasonably priced. Staff were friendly and helpful. Would stay there again if we were lucky enough to go back to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Rosedale Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Linda1414
Reviews.Content: We have been twice in the last three months...and before that as well. Excellent service, great restaurant/pub attached with great atmosphere. The suite we had was great, very comfortable and clean. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SaltSpringCurt
Reviews.Content: Location, location,location. Walk to: Vancouver's two major sports arenas, Yaletown for hip restaurants, Robson shopping, Vancouver's unique library, Vancouver Art Museum, Gastown and hope a inner harbour ferry to Granville Island. We also had our skis for Vancouver's three city ski areas. Our home was part of VI timeshare. Just the right space and great view. There is a pool and spa, free morning newspapers and restaurant on site.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: xmasphenatic
Reviews.Content: We had 2 short stays here before and after a trip to Whistler. Our room was comfy and had everything we needed. Bed was a bit firm. No in room safe but we were able to have a safety deposit box at reception. Location was good, we were able to walk everywhere. There was a grocery shop over the road and a restaurant attached to the hotel. We weren't happy with the concierge when we booked a bus to Whistler only to find there had been a problem with the booking and it hadn't been made, we were told a message had been left for us but we hadn't received it. The concierge on the next shift sorted it and got us on a bus at the last minute. We would stay again for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: unknownis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with wife and young infant son about three years ago. Caught a lift from the airport with some friends. Large room, nice view. Breakfast was very nice, so was the pool. Staff were very friendly - they helped me fit a car seat into a hired car, sonething which would have taken me forever...and gave me directions, very helpful. had food in the resteraunt, but pricy but was OK. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: Tina8
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night only while we were in town for the Sting concert. The hotel was great, the lobby, restaurant, room and yes hallways, were all very nice and clean. The bed and pillows were good and the room itself (room 1412) had a nice view of the library... Two flat screen tvs, a small kitchenette and a sitting room, nice size bedroom with queen bed. You can walk to everything, the Queen Elizabeth Theatre, shops on Granville and Robson, BC Place.... Would definitely stay again.... Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Old Rooms”
Reviews.Author: pirlie
Reviews.Content: When we drove up to this hotel the outside and lobby was very nice. As soon as we went to the room we were very dissapointed!! The room was very old, outdated. The bedding was old, I didn't even want to sit on it! The beds are not comfy. The bathroom is small. For the price we paid I would not go back! They need a major update done to the rooms here.

Reviews.Title: “Fine quality and convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: fastL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for7 nights and must say the room and staff were ideal. Helpful in every way. The room was well equipped and large with great views. And being next to the laundry room was very handy. With on site parking this was an ideal hotel, but was also near the Train and bus routes which made getting to the numerous attractions much easier. The staff on the floors were efficient and tidy and the concierge and reception staff could not have been more helpful. We really enjoyed our trip and would certainly use the Rosedale on Robson again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: fishstorm
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in September 11. Arrived 4.5 hours before check in time and was allowed straight into room, always a bonus. It was more a suite than a room, with a lounge area and a small kitchenette, we only made use of the fridge but it was very welcome. The bed was enormous and we both slept wonderfully well. The staff arranged our bus/ferry to Victoria and back with only 20 minutes notice and it worked just fine. The hotel isn't the prettiest but who goes to Vancouver to stay in the hotel, for what you pay, you get a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Rillabub
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything you could need. The bedroom was nice and the little lounge/kitchen was great to have. The staff were helpful and it is in a good location. We used the laundry twice, good to get everything clean before you move on as we were away for 4 weeks. The only thing that we did not like was the price in the restaurant Rosie's. The service charge was a bit much. The food was ok but over priced. All in all it was good for us and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely for families”
Reviews.Author: iwaswayoff
Reviews.Content: The only bad thing I can really say about this hotel (and it may be a matter of opinion), is that the bed seemed really hard. It is very nice to have a separate room for watching TV. There is also a small kitchen. The kid can stay on the sofa bed while you take the room. The lobby is quite big and nice and the staff very friendly and helpful. The hotel bar seems to be a sports bar of sorts with $15 dinner specials. Ask for wifi through reception, it was only $5 a night. $10 if you just went online and signed up.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine!”
Reviews.Author: saladi
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was just fine although the decor is a bit dated, the bed is not as large as at other hotels, and the rooms are fairly small. But we were out and about all day and just wanted somewhere to lay our heads at night after a quick snack so this filled the bill nicely. The separate sitting room felt a bit more like home and it was nice not to have to sit on the bed as with one-room accommodation. The kitchenette was adequately equipped for a heat-up meal and a coffee, although the dishes were not washed in the morning - it seems we are supposed to wash them ourselves which is not quite what I expect from a hotel, but that's a minor point. There was a daily charge of $5 for Wifi but we were only charged for 1 day after our 2-night stay, perhaps to make up for all the problems we had with the telephone - couldn't ring internationally or to a 1800 number, despite visiting reception and being told the phone was fine. Overall however, our stay was pleasant, the location is excellent and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of room!!”
Reviews.Author: Vicki S
Reviews.Content: We were very, very comfortable at the Rosedale on Robson. A large lounge area & kitchenette make travelling with the family so much nicer. The staff were very friendly and helpful to us. The hotel is situated well, with most attractions like Canada Place & Gastown a very easy walk. We really enjoyed our time in Vancouver and would recommend this Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Time to renovate or at least clean the carpet!”
Reviews.Author: GS3109
Reviews.Content: I've seen so dirty carpet only once in my life - it was in the middle of nowhere in 1-star motel (had to stop there because of the road conditions). Starting from hallways and continuing to the room - greasy, spotty 80-s carpet which was never washed. I've made a reservation on hotel's website for a "deluxe" queen bedroom two weeks before our weekend in Vancouver, but the only one that was available was 2 double beds (giving my hubby's complexion, we had to sleep separately because of that). Kids enjoyed their sofa bed, although an adult would be uncomfortable, since you can feel springs by gently pressing on the top of the mattress. Beds are motel quality with very uncomfy waffle blankets, dated as well as early 80-s. (If this is a deluxe room, how uncomfy are standard rooms then?). Beds linens are, although, clean and white; we had extra pillows for all 4 of us and stuff brought us couple more. It looks like their re-painted our room a few months ago, but, gosh, change the carpets! They are scary looking.... We also had a very strange heater/cooler/fan in our room - it seems to sense changes in milli-degree, since if it is set on 70, it will turn itself on and off every few seconds. Giving the noise this monster makes, it is hard to fall asleep if it is not completely shut down. We had to turn it off for the night - thankfully it is fall outside and window could be open to ventilate the room. Kitchenette is also 80-s, kind of a military condo style (steel doors, stainless steel, everything compact and build in like on the submarine) , but has bigger than usual refrigerator and all the dishes and silverware. It is spotless clean and working just fine. There is also an electric kettle and a teapot for those tea lovers besides usual coffeemaker. We also had unexpected surprise with hotel's pet policy - although it is advertized on their website as pet friendly and no conditions are mentioned, there is a 15 dollars/day fee, plus, they will not service your room if pet is present. There is not a word about that in both hotel’s guest service book as well as on their website. If you will look at expedia - it is listed there, but you had to dig for that info and, obviously, we were unprepared for that charge. As a result - no cleaning service and 30$ extra charge... Hotel location is convenient for the city visitors - both trolley and big bus tours have stop just around the corner, plus downtown Vancouver is not so huge to walk around and hotel is in the safe part of it. It is a quite noisy at evening due to he proximity to the stadiums and multiple public bars/restaurants around, so be prepared to either not open windows at night or use earplugs. On the good side there is a small, but clean pool, steam room, sauna and Jacuzzi on the first floor of the hotel. Water in the pool is comfortably warm, Jacuzzi is a little bit deeper than usual - water is just below my chin if I will sit there and I am taller than average person. The only strange, but apparently effective (and maybe "green"?) thing in this pool that cracks in the glass wall and gaps between doors and frames are patched with clear packaging tape. This original repair trick makes pool air warm and you do not feel draughts of cold outside air. Overall, I do not think our family will stay in this hotel again unless some major renovation will take place. There are plenty of other hotels around in a similar price range for us to try. As I see from other reviews, some rooms in this hotel were given a facelifts already. Hopefully, this tendency will be continued.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: billr70079
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in October 2011. What a great location in the heart of Vancouver! Our room was a one bedroom suite with a small kitchen area. The room was very clean. Our check-in service was as good as anyplace I've been with no drama or surprises. We had to call maintenance twice for a couple of minor issues and they fixed them immediately. The views of the city are wonderful. We will stay here again on our next trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Content: Just come back to UK after after spending 3 fantastic weeks in the Rosedale. Staff could not do enough for you, a big thank you to everyone for making us feel so important. We had a wonderful room on the 20th floor, so the views from the floor to ceiling windows were to die for. This was our second trip to the city of Vancouver, no doubt we will be returning in a few years and I know what hotel we will be choosing. Thank you all again and our apologies for setting off the smoke alarm on our first morning after burning the toast ! ! ! Pete & Sue Chapman Devon UK

Reviews.Title: “Spacious accommodation and great location”
Reviews.Author: RachelAdelaide
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 nights in September 2011 with my 2 adult daughters. The apartment was very spacious and the sofabed more than adequate. The beds were very comfortable also. We did not experience any slowness of the lifts and the internet, even though it was a bit slow, was only $5/24hrs. Worth having in the room for the iPad. Great location to walk downtown and to get to Skytrain. Also IGA by front door and great supermarket 1 block away with nearby pharmacy also. Huge choice of eateries in Robson Street a definite advantage, although the onsite restaurant was really good. Reception staff were extremely helpful with requests, even organising a fast luggage repair for us. Definitely a great place to stay if you are needing more space.

Reviews.Title: “Will definately be back!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rosedale on Robson in March 2011 and thoroughly enjoyed our visit. The hotel was lovely, our appartment had a fantastic view and the service was brilliant from the reception staff. Being our first stop on a 2 month trip through Canada meant we had a lot of questions, and the wonderful reception staff were always happy to help...no matter what time of the day or night. We loved the location, right in the middle of the city, everything you needed nearby and only a 10 minute walk to Rogers Stadium (highly recommend going to see an Ice Hockey game there) and a beautiful 45 minute walk down the waterfront to Stanley Park (with plenty of lovely places to stop for lunch on the way). We loved our stay in the beautiful city of Vancouver and will definately be back....we would not consider staying anywhere else but the Rosedale on Robson - great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great central location, would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: M00123
Reviews.Content: Nice accommodation and located in walking distance to the harbour, IGA grocery store, pharmacy/chemist, restaurants, McDonalds etc. Kitchen was useful to have, as was access to the laundry facilties (located on the odd floors and $1.25 per load of washing - to either wash or dry). The only minor downsides were that we had to pay for Internet access, and that the lifts seemed quite slow. Would certainly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: DollyDimpel
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with a friend for 2 nights and didnt have any complaints about it. For the price (and Vancouver is expensive) I felt this was a good deal. Everything was clean and functional and adequate for a couple of days. We were only really sleeping here so didnt spend much time in the room as sightseeing was more important. The beds were really comfy and the room was quiet despite being on a lower floor. We didnt use the pool but it appeared to be clean. All the staff were friendly and helpful and we enjoyed a few drinks in Rosies (the bar attached to the hotel). There seemed to be quite a few dogs in this hotel but no signs of doggy smells or hairs..(now that would be cause for complaint!). Overall a good hotel and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: bellakash
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Rosedale on Sat. night with my daughters for the Taylor Swift concert. It was a last minute thing and the Rosedale was the only hotel that had a room available. I've stayed in other downtown Vancouver hotels on Robson and the Rosedale is not worth what it charges compared to the others. The room is dated, dark and we had to use the bedding from the dresser. I pulled out the pillows and they had long dark hairs on them! Also room service dishes left in the hall from our neighbors were there for 24 hours. Upon arriving and leaving I noticed that the lovely large glass doors and windows were FULL of smudges and fingerprints that looked as if they had been there for a month. Great location Rosedale and polite staff but please update and pay attention to those little details!

Reviews.Title: “we had all the amenities we needed , a suite hotel , very comfy, close to downtown and Robson Street, rogers arena, skyt”
Reviews.Author: jasmine499148
Reviews.Content: Great location , rosies resteraunt awesome food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: mastersbaby
Reviews.Content: I booked at the Rosedale to take my daughter & her friend to see the Taylor Swift concert and with the hotel's close proximity to GM Place I thought we'd be happy with our choice. Boy was I sadly disappointed. Our room (on the 4th floor) was dark, dingy, outdated & overpriced for what we got. The living room area had no windows so it was very dark, the chairs & couch were uncomfortable, the TV was small and outdated, the bathroom was small, dark & had no counter space, we didn't have enough towels for three people & had to call housekeeping for two more bath towels! The in-room amenities were sorely lacking. My daughter & her friend burst out laughing when they say the Ninetendo 64 game console in the room as they had no idea what it even was the gaming system was so outdated! The kitchenette was very tacky & outdated. Our beds were small and the bedding was comparable to that of a Super 8 Motel...lackluster & uncomfortable, again with a small old TV in our room. We found the stairwell to the parking area smelled bad and the elevators were very slow. The service was terrible and Rosie's was terrible and we walked out after waiting for 30 minutes without even so much as a drink being brought to our table. Finally the Wifi service was terrible... For a $200+/night room, I would have expected so much more.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: JazzFSJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rosedale on Robson as we wanted a hotel in the downtown area where my daughter and her husband could stay with us to save some money. The hotel is a suite hotel and our room had a bedroom, sofa bed and kitchenette. The matress on the sofa bed and bed weren't that comfortable, but the room was great and the view from the 10th floor window was awesome. The hotel is conveniently located and we walked to the granville island boat and to the skytrain stations easily. Would recommend for anyone wanting to stay in the downtown area. There is an IGA, McDonalds and 7 11 nearby to pick up food for breakfast if you want to eat in the room.

Reviews.Title: “We are happy and would return”
Reviews.Author: Mike H
Reviews.Content: We checked into a deluxe suite which consisted of a sitting area and a bedroom with two queen beds. The place was clean, fully kitted kitchen, and clean modern bathroom. Staff were professional and helpful. The only down point is the charge for internet on a daily basis. When hotels in remote Canada are prepred to provide free internet, its a little harsh to charge for this service.

Reviews.Title: “Needs work”
Reviews.Author: AmaWW
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there in September 2010 due to a gift certificate. There are good and bad from this hotel. The positives, the location of the hotel is right downtown on Robson. Close to all the shopping, restaurants, and arena. The swimming pool is a decent size and the sauna was nice after a long day. The guys at concierge were excellent in providing information. The suites have a mini kitchen with a stove, oven, and fridge. The downside, the hotel is in need of some updating. The suite we were assigned was one that we had to go through 2 doors to get into which was a little difficult to get into with large luggage. When we got into the room we turned on the light switch to find we had no power. I called the front desk where they informed me that I would have to flip the light switch outside of my suite in order to get power inside the suite. The suite is small, and is in need of some redecorating. The kitchenette was right outside our small bathroom. The bedroom was a decent size and had large windows. At the time the hotel did not have any king size beds. The living room had a sofa, a desk and an old box TV. It has the basics. We tried to check out before 10 AM, but the elevators took a long time. When the elevator did arrive onto our floor there were too many people inside. The couple waiting by the elevator before us commented that they had waited for 15 minutes. After a while we decided to take the stairs with our luggage. The hotel being an older building has narrow stairwell and when you reached the second floor, one side of it had banquet equipment along it. My husband and I were happy that we stayed on a gift certificate to experience the hotel. We don’t think we will be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: DrPlmr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as a RCI exchange,and was very disappointed. The location is reasonably good for access to downtown. There are many diverse food outlets nearby for less formal eating. "Rosies" the on site restaurant tries to be a British pub, but fails. I do not like service charges preloaded on my food bill ! The living accommodation was dark with hardly any natural light, the bedroom at the front had a full wall of glass,so plenty of light!! The floor of the kichenette was in a very poor state,and I was able to cut my foot on badly maintained floorboards. There was no housekeeping all week, we had to take garbage down in the lift from the 15th.floor, (nice for other guests). There was no change of towels all week, despite being promised a new set by the reception desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Made our wedding day even better!”
Reviews.Author: 49Charlie
Reviews.Content: We checked in for 2 days Aug 20, 21 2011 for our wedding and had the perfect hotel experience. It was very tough to find reasonably priced rooms for block booking downtown. We actually started with the Georgian Court but when we talked to the Rosedale they were $60.00 cheaper! That's huge when your asking friends to spend money to come attend your wedding. We booked with the Rosedale right away. They even honoured our block pricing with late comers. The hotel was exactly what we needed, clean, professional, well managed and very friendly. The connected pub is excellent as well. We discovered an extra treat on check in when we found out they had put us in a honeymoon suite on the top floor - wine and a HUGE fruit basket! Super nice of them as we weren't expecting anything. The suite had a HUGE balcony on the roof with an amazing view. The suite was perfect - nothing wrong or broken, great coffee maker (huge for me as that's the first time I've ever enjoyed a morning coffee in a any hotel room). Many thanks to Jody Spackman from the Rosedale for taking awesome care of us!!! THANK YOU!!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD CHOICE”
Reviews.Author: Coutas
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel with Hotels.com after comments in Trip adviser Reviews. We booked for two nights following a cruise on the Diamond Princess starting In Beijing.The hotel was perfect for our needs and within easy walking distance to the Main shopping area,Hop on hop off bus and the Ferry terminal (for Grouse Mountain) Our room was spacious and very clean with comfortable bed. The staff were friendly and the adjoining restaurant was very good value for food and drinks. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and walkable to Stanley Park”
Reviews.Author: MasonsDad
Reviews.Content: Given the typical prices in Vancouver, this hotel is an excellent value. It is in a great part of town....close to Stanley Park, great restaurants and shops and all of the room are suites (including stove, appliances, fridge, etc.). There is a swimming pool, sauna, jacuzzi, steam room and work out room. The room was very clean and we got a 2 bedroom suite for $147USD per night. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: gooseSolihull
Reviews.Content: Noisy air con rooms at front can be very disturbing with the sreet noise. resturant managed by another company food not good expensive.carparking is expensive. Staff not very positive. at front desk.In need of a refit looking tired the rooms are fresh painted in white look clean.Rates are high. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: natureluvr62
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vancouver, visiting family that lives there. My husband and I brought our two teens, 19 and 16. We booked the Rosedale on Robson because we had seen reviews that it was a good choice for families with children. We decided to book the family suite. Even though the living/kitchen area is a little small, I would highly recommend this for families. The windows are in the bedrooms so it felt a little dark and claustrophibic in the living area, but we didn't stay in the room that much so it wasn't a problem. We took advantage of the continental breakfast each day as Vancouver is quite expensive and there was something for everyone. The location was perfect, not right in the thick of the downtown but within walking distance to almost everything. The only disappointment was the hot tub and steam room were out of order for a good part of our week. The hotel was kind enough to give us a small credit for the days the hot tub was out of order, which we really appreciated. The pool is rather small but refreshing after a long day of running around. The staff and housekeeping were amazing, friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: k3k10
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and in a great location. We got to enjoy Granville Street and were only blocks away from the Commodore where we were seeing a concert. I would definently come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Will always come back here.”
Reviews.Author: Maxar
Reviews.Content: Great hotel location. Lots of food and attractions close by.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place close to BC place”
Reviews.Author: Bosley2705
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a one bedroom. Positive: Clean, quiet, close to BC place and Rogers arena. Good bed. Negative: small bathroom, too much furniture in room, 2 km away from shopping and restaurant area of downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “not impressed”
Reviews.Author: loveydove
Reviews.Content: my husband and I stayed at the Robson with our children. My husband just arrived from san fransico and had given me a beautiful banner of a buddha and a beautiful phrase on it.. i hung it over the door to the bedroom and left it there by mistake.. i emailed the hotel numberous times and never got a reply back. We left a huge tip for the maid and requested NO cleanup during our stay and made sure the room was nice and neat when we left.. i was dissapointed not receiving even ONE email indicating anything on my banner.. will not go back. :(

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: davetoni
Reviews.Content: A little dated but clean,kitchenette and separate lounge area

Reviews.Title: “A local BC guy staying in a Vancouver Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoWithoutBorders
Reviews.Content: First things first.....I used to live in an apartment complex literally right across from the Rosedale on Robson. I now live in Coquitlam. Every time my family from Sydney, Australia would visit, they would stay at this hotel. They would love it. My entire family including nephews came to visit me early July and they all decided to stay in the Rosedale. They had the opportunity to stay in our home in Coquitlam though wanted to be in the centre of all the action in downtown Vancouver. I ended up staying in the Rosedale for a few nights the very first time myself for a few days with my family. The suites were very big with full kitchen appliances: cooker, microwave, sink, cooking pans, utensils and much more. This could all be closed off from the bedroom area which was still fairly big. The kitchen area had ample sitting. In general, the suites very big and nice and quite. Underground parking was only $11 a day which is very good for downtown Vancouver. The maids were always polite and cleaned the rooms very well each day. There is an indoor swimming pool and my nephews loved it. Next to this was a hot tub. Before taxes the room was about $175 a night which is excellent for downtown Vancouver. This came with comlimentary, continental breakfast served each day until 9.30am. My family have stayed at the Rosedale several times now and really enjoy coming back here every time they come to see me. I give it a definite thumbs up in every respect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: gorilla60
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here,centrally located in the heart of the city..Short walk to great shops and all the sights. Great clean comfy room with excellen kitchen facilities.Friendly,approachable knowledgable staff.Rosies restaurant downstairs great value for money and great food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: bilko1950
Reviews.Content: Great location. Staff were very good and friendly. Room was clean, spacious and light.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: CoffsAbroad
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed during March 2011. We both thoroughly enjoyed staying at Rosedale's, mostly because of the location. Never having been in Vancouver before my husband and I would set out walking a different direction each day and by the end of the week we had literally walked all over town. The hotel is in prime position to access both Gastown and Yaletown, not to mention Robson street itself is the main shopping hub of Vancouver. It's within walking distance to the stadium if you feel like catching a hockey game, the hotel even offers hockey/hotel packages. Walk just up the street and bus no. 19 will take you directly to Stanley Park. The restaurant that is attached can get quite busy with an 'after work's crowd but this dies down after dinner time. The restaurant mainly features burgers, as like anywhere some waiters are better than others. Overall the food is OK, or there are numerous eateries on Robson Street, including MacDonalds across the road. The rooms was larger than we expected, great views (especially at night) and the room and hotel was always extremely clean.

Reviews.Title: “Go Canucks and Vancouver! Oh and the Robson!”
Reviews.Author: phantom_girl00000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from June 5th 2011 to June 7th 2011. Was pleasantly surprised with the hotel. Comfortable spacious rooms, clean and comfortable beds. When we checked in the staff were kind enough to give us a balcony which looked directly at Grouse mountain and the lights on the mountain at night! While we were there the Canucks were playing in the NHL finals series and people were everywhere when the game was on! The city did an amazing job to block off streets and allow people to watch the game outside. Overall an excellent hotel especially for the price, would definately stay there again! Location on Robson street is excellent with a 10-15 minute stroll to the main areas and heaps of food nearby in Yaletown.

Reviews.Title: “Very average. Did not want to spend too long in the room.”
Reviews.Author: Lw2309
Reviews.Content: The Rosedale on Robson hotel was very average. We stayed for two nights and were located on the 8th floor which was old fashioned and in need of a revamp. The TVs were old and showed a fuzzy picture, the Nintendo console was old and not free, the wifi was not free and their business centre consisted of one computer in the lobby. Who charges for wifi these days?!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel if slightly dated”
Reviews.Author: KINGKONG3
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here for a couple of nights in May. The hotel is good for both downtown and yaletown areas. It's also a short walk to Davie street or to catch an aquabus to Granville island. The suites were clean, a good size, and we had a good nights sleep as well. The rooms do look a little dated, especially the kitchen area - but it's not much of a problem and the hotel was good value so no big deal. I would stay here again for the location, but have stayed in a better Vancouver hotel for the same money. NOTE: No reflection on the hotel, but we did get given a counterfeit note in the restaurant on our first day (didn't notice until later) - a good reminder for tourists to always check your change (our $10 note was missing the sliver strip down the side)

Reviews.Title: “Time for some updating”
Reviews.Author: Doug_Heffernan
Reviews.Content: Wow this hotel needs some updating. Decent location with free parking. Had two double suite with pull out couch in separate room. Tvs are tiny and from the 1980s. Beds not very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: traveldad11
Reviews.Content: Stayed there to run in the bmo 1/2 Marathon. Read a few mixed reviews upon booking but figured at worst, the location was worth it. More than pleasantly surprised!! Our 16th floor bay window room overlooked the city/mountains, the beds were super comfortable , the little kitchen (with Kuerig coffee maker-very nice touch) was a bonus, and the proximity to everything was great. Our housekeeping staff were some of the friendliest I have encountered and the concierge(?) gave me some great tips on how to get cheap tickets for the hockey game which was just an added bonus. If management is trying to make a change for the better here, I would say they are doing a heck of a good job. Are the rooms a bit dated yes, but it is an established hotel and for the price, I was very impressed. I will, if the price remains close to the same, make this my first choice when back in Vancouver. By the way, great restaurant downstairs with good beer on tap.

Reviews.Title: “At least there were no cockroaches”
Reviews.Author: Wordfiend
Reviews.Content: Baded on several interactions with staff, the culture of this hotel was definitely NOT customer-centric. These included telling me to get off the elevator as it would not stop at the lobby on the way to the basement (to return dirty dishes to the kitchen), telling me to go to the front desk and get a special green slip in order to charge room service to my room. WTF? (I was sick with a very bad cold and had changed into my jammies.) Room was bare bones. Bed was hard. Bathroom was ridiculously tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel for years Now it is not..”
Reviews.Author: pajim20
Reviews.Content: Family been stayin here for years and other family members,Been in hotel field for 28 years..Well came over to watch Rod Stewart and got the room and went to the room and dropped hand bags off and went shopping went back to room and went for fast dip in pool and hot tub..tub not even @ 94 degrees like takin a bath,,Chlorine over max ,so went for a swim..cold not any where near 84 degress maybe 65 degrees so went back to room and noticed the oven on...went to switch off switch shaft broken (oven on broil) So removed fuses and went to front desk to report issue..Not much done..from staff.Gee just save the building from fire your welcome.So went to concert and came back @ 11:30 pm and went to lay in bed and turned TV on red screen then picture then red ..screen....well next morning not much sleep beds hard as sleepin on floor..went to have a mornin shower tub had ants in bathroom...that is not all went to check out and they charged me a $1.25 for a 1-800 number..do not get me wrong I am a maintenance man for hotels for 28 years and hold a swimming pool cert. will I stay here again I do not think so...a shame cause I like the hotel and location..

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sweetvernon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel to see the vancouver canucks game.It is in a excellent location,it only took us about a 5 minute walk to get to Rogers arena.Robson street is right there and gas town is also a 15 min walk.Our room was dated and tired needs refreshening for sure.The size of the room was great,really nice to put our son to bed and we could watch T.V in the living area.The beds were small for 2 adults and hard.Free continental breakfast ,great coffee.I do have 2 things that I was not happy with.The hot tub was colder than my bath water,I asked three times if they could please turn up the temp. A couple of other ladies asked as well.They never did bother to turn it up, one staff member told me it was at regulation temp.All I know, is that was the coolest hot tub I`ve ever been in,so I was dissapointed because that is something I look forward to.Plus the elevator was sooo slow,we stood waiting 5-8 min,we always ended up taking the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: occy2
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Rosedale on Robson, on the 13th floor, in a 2 bedroom suite, which included a galley kitchen and sitting area. We found the location was excellent for sightseeing and we enjoyed the view of the city from the floor to ceiling windows. Unfortunately we found the "living" area very dark (40 watt bulbs) and extremely claustrophobic and in dire need of refurbishment. If we had been there for just a nite or two, we probably wldn't have noticed it so much but for a longer stay it was definitely noticable.

Reviews.Title: “rooms”
Reviews.Author: deb1958_309
Reviews.Content: Hi we just got back from taking parents to a Canuck game and stayed at rosedale pkg hockey tickets and rooms,it was great the rooms where so big and nice they could up grade there tvs,but overall very clean and nice.The only complaint that I have is that the restaurant we stopped to havea drink and our limes we so old and dried out and went to bartender and asked for 2 more and he told me he wasnt on for another 15 mins and walked away with a att like that he wont be working for long,so I told our waitress and she was so sorry and she said the drinks where on them that was very nice.other then that I would recemmend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing rooms; though good location and value”
Reviews.Author: SF_intrepidwanderer
Reviews.Content: My first impression up seeing our room...I wish I'd booked through airbnb or vrbo. I was looking for a somewhat larger space (with a separate sleeping area from the main room) and Rosedale on Robson seemed to fit the bill at a reasonable price. However, upon seeing my dark, dingy room filled with old furniture and a sagging mattress, I wish I'd booked a condo rental instead. It's particularly disappointing because given the location of the hotel and its generally "good bones", it seems even a small investment to spiff up the hotel could make a huge difference. Pros: + Location: a few blocks from the Skytrain, about a 5-10 minute walk to Yaletown water front and in the midst of downtown. Very convenient. + Reasonable rates (about $130 a night, not including taxes) + Large rooms with kitchenettes and ample fridges Cons: - Dated, dingy rooms: Looks like the hotel hasn't been remodeled for 15-20 years. Furniture is dated and chipped and randomly placed (mismatched furniture suggests it wasn't designed for this space). A traveling companion described the "atmosphere" as "depressing single occupancy hotel". It was hard to relax in the room and we found ourselves wandering around and hanging out at coffee shops instead. - No wifi (let's just say the hotel guide still has instructions on how to use dial up internet service...enough said). - Lack of light: Perhaps a room on a higher floor have better light, but our suite only had 1 window (in the bedroom) which didn't let in much light. The living room area was perpetually gloomy and dark, even with all the lights on. - Dingy: There were weird stains on the door between the living and bedroom area and our bedspread was pretty dusty, otherwise clean given the age of the hotel. - Uncomfortable mattress: Mattress was pretty uncomfortable (saggy and could feel the springs); sofa bed was even worse. - Lack of blankets: Even though it was the middle of winter (Feb) the only blanket in our room was 1 thin cotton coverlet, which left us freezing. We asked for another blanket the next night and received a second thin coverlet (not ideal, but at least bearable). - Lack of security: The garage is open for general public parking and the garage elevators go straight up to hotel room levels, without keycard security anywhere. Having rented holiday apartments in nearby Yaletown in the past and having seen what you can get for about $125-150 per night (a well-furnished, full-size apartment), I would recommend going that route versus the Rosedale...I certainly wish I had.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Transit”
Reviews.Author: Itchyfeet02
Reviews.Content: This was a transit stop on our way into Europe. Arrived early so room was not ready. Left our luggage and walked into town but nothing was open yet. When we got to our room it seemed a little dated and very dark even with all lights on. Aircon (heater) was very noisy during the night so we slept with it off. The room seemed to maintain a comfortable temperature anyway. Restaurant was not too bad although we did not eat there every day. The biggest advantage of this hotel is its proximity to everything - shopping, restaurants and public transport ( Vancouver has a very good public transport system - $9CAD day pass for unlimitted travel on public buses (including the sea bus) and rail network). Overall this hotel is comfortable and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, great location, very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: MRBAus
Reviews.Content: Coming from Australia we didnt know what to expect but we were impressed for the price; we had a suite, bedroom with kitchenette and living room.The bedroom was very spacious. We were upgraded and stayed on the 16th floor. The downfall would have to be the lack of gym(only couple of treadmills) but it does have a pool. THe continental breakfast is pretty average however it is Free and has all the basics. Also xompared to other parts of the worls $25 for 7day net connection was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay loved the city”
Reviews.Author: Kenlie
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days in Vancouver after cruising Alaska and before heading off on the Rocky Mountaineer to Jasper. We wanted to stay at a hotel that was reasonably close to all tourists attractions, having never visited Vancouver before. We like walking and we walked to explore as many areas as we could in 3 days, a couple of blocks from the waterfront, also not too far from the water taxis that took you over to the Granville Island markets. We caught a water taxi over to catch the bus in West Vancouver to go to the Capilano suspension bridge and Grouse mountain. The hotel room suited us perfectly, very clean small kitchenette and lounge area, very quiet. We met friends at and dined at Rosies Restaurant which is on site, excellent meal and great value and atmosphere

Reviews.Title: “Good base for a Vancouver stopover”
Reviews.Author: Volkera
Reviews.Content: This was a good medium range hotel that is well located within most of Vancouver's sights. Rooms are getting a bit tired but are spacious and there is plenty of space to spread out. The eating options within the hotel are reasonably priced and there are many eating places within a short walk. Disappointed with the fairly costly wifi connection, given that most other hotels in North America now offer free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, everything you need is provided”
Reviews.Author: RosNorthumberland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week while we were visiting our daughter who is working in Vancouver. We had a free upgrade: our suite comprised bedroom with 2 queen-sized beds, bathroom with shower over bath, cleverly designed kitchenette and spacious sitting room. An extra bed was provided so our daughter could stay with us at no extra cost, with all linen included. Virtually everything had been thought of to make the stay comfortable - e.g. the kitchenette included toaster and coffee maker and even washing up liquid and cloths, as well as cooker, large fridge and microwave. The room was serviced to a high standard every day. There are washing machines for those who need them, and you can even borrow an umbrella from the hotel at no charge. The staff were all polite and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel ,helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Geraldine42
Reviews.Content: Arrived here directly from airport ,tired and in need of freshening up.Were told on arrival we had been given a complimentary upgrade.Suite was very spacious and clean.Reception staff were very helpful about travel tips and generally very pleasant.Hotel is well situated for walking or public transport around the city.Rosies restaurant was good food at reasonable prices.We had a very pleasant four days there and I would recommend it to anyone traveling to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Good, as long as you like a very firm mattress”
Reviews.Author: DebbieB2010
Reviews.Content: Room was roomy. It had a kitchenette that was most handy to cut down eating out expenses. Beds were a little hard, and shower was an economising one, that was very hard on the skin. However it was in a great location, staff were friendly and Rosie's Restaurant that was attached was excellent as was their food room service. The cleaner did forget on more than one occasion that there were 3 in the room, so 3 towels were required, but an extra towel was always promptly delivered when we queried it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location :- However Poor Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Interspec
Reviews.Content: Initially arrived in late afternoon to find room was not ready additional 2 hour wait, staff proved reasonability helpful. One we gained access to room old smelly food from prior stay left in refrigerator. Room was very cold and temperature control was not functional. Towel rack in bathroom was a dangerous height and caused eye injury, this should be noted that if you taller this hotel is not for you. General cleanliness of bathroom was ok however there were spots of mould on lower levers of tiles, more care should be taken on cleaning and disinfection. Lots of dust and dirt behind cabinets and TVs. Business amenities were very poor internet was charged at an alarming $15 per day and proved to be very slow and useless. Pool and gym facilities were limited, Pool did contain a lot of suspended solids should be checked. Restaurant was very good and staff very friendly and polite. Overall location was good but Westin is just around the corner and similar priced I would recommend this as an option.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: jimibob
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our stopping off point for 2 nights before joining an Alaska cruise, I'd looked on Trip Advisor prior to our trip to check other reviews of this hotel and found them to be very mixed; so much so that I had pretty mixed feelings about our stay there. However, I'm bound to say it would be hard to find any serious criticism of the Rosedale. Reception was spacious, the hotel bar and restaurant welcoming and our suite was extremely well appointed and comfortable. My wife was a bit intimidated by the floor to ceiling window on the 18th floor, but the view was well worth it. So far as location was concerned, ideal for Yaletown, a short walk to Gastown or the Granville Island ferries, and all of Robson Street to explore. I'd happily stay there again, especially as Vancouver is my favourite city.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: thecoastcouple
Reviews.Content: The location was wonderful. The value can't be beat. The decoration and furniture are a little dated. I have stayed in several suite hotels in Vancouver and this definitely is the best deal. There are nicer suite hotels but they are much more expensive. One of very few hotels that over 2 twin beds in the second bedroom in the 2 bedroom suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, love the room size but a couple of problems...”
Reviews.Author: madeiramom
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a couple of times in the past year. We chose it because they offer suites with separate bedrooms and we travel with a teen and a toddler so we can put the toddler to bed and still stay up and watch a bit of TV and chat. I love the downtown location, so convenient for walking to the shops and restaurants. The rooms are usually well appointed and suit our needs. The probems we've had on two different trips: The restaurant is terrible! (not sure if it's actually part of the hotel...you can charge your meals to the room so I suppose so) The service is just about the worst I've experienced in a LONG time and the staff is rude and inefficient. They take forever to seat you, ignoring that you're standing by the door, take forever to get to take your order, though the place is next to empty and then bring the wrong meals after a ridiculously long wait! We won't be returning to the restaurant, EVER! The first time we visited, the room keys didn't work, I had to keep going back to the front desk to get them to "rekey" it and each time it didn't work. I made about 4-5 trips up and down the elevator while my family waited in the hall...it would have been nice if they'd sent someone up to help. Parking...make SURE you don't pay in the parkade before registering! It's very deceiving as it makes it look like you should pay and then register but it'll cost you 3 times the price to do it this way. I complained to the desk staff about it but they brushed me off.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money! Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: BonVoyageAKL
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Vancouver escorting a group joining a cruise in Vancouver. We chose Rosedale on Robson as it had a good reputation, good location and good rates. I checked out two days later totally satisfied with my stay and our choice. The group members all agreed. The rooms are much larger than standard hotel rooms and while not flash the extra space and convenience of the kitchenette and lounge area is a bonus. While the reception area is small the restaurant/bar is good value and service excellent. Bellhop/Tour desk staff were extra good! It is in a good location, a but quieter but still walking distance to shopping and with a number of small restuarants and eateries. Two conveniences stores within 100m is a handy. For the money this is one of the best value hotels we use anywhere in the world. Gerard Murphy Bon Voyage Cruises & Travel, Auckland, NZ

Reviews.Title: “A good comfortable, centrally placed hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Molly046
Reviews.Content: The Rosedale was a good choice for the final two nights of our B C holiday. It was well placed for Downtown although if we were to go to Vancouver again, we would probably chose a hotel closer to the sea. We had a good street map of Vancouver (a must) and found it easily. The hotel staff were helpful and we were able to take our bags to our room before driving to Canada Place to drop off the hire car. If you book with National/Alamo it isn't easy to either locate the drop off point which is in the underground car park adjacent to Canada Place, not even the local taxi driver we asked knew where it was. Once in the car park, the signs disappear and it takes a while to locate the right area. It took us a good 30 minutes to walk back to the Hotel, take a look at the library building on the way back, it's amazing. Although we had booked a double room, we were upgraded to a suite on the 16th floor so had a brilliant view of the City. There was a well equipped kitchen, big bedroom, small lounge area and 'neat' bathroom, all very clean. We found it quieter to keep the bedroom window closed and the lounge window open for ventilation. For those that like it, the air contioning was very efficient. Meals could be obtained in 'Rosies' resturant next to the lobby and although we didn't eat here plenty of people did and, when we called in for a drink one night, the food looked good and the staff were friendly. By walking four blocks we were able to get the number 19 bus to Stanley Park. It cost $2.50 and you could return on this ticket within 90 minutes. The Sky Train is four blocks in the other direction, downhill, an easy 15 minute walk and it cost $3.75 to get to the Airport, we were quoted $35.00 for a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “not what i expected”
Reviews.Author: frippy1
Reviews.Content: we booked the rosedale through expedia and expected what was advertised. we got there to find a useless 'guest service supervisor' and a room completely different from everything on the website. no flat screen TV's, no comfy couch and not even propper bedding. we found ourselves tangled up each night in the top sheets they like to use over the matress and a non-warm sythetic funny blanket. only after asking twice did we get a decent comforter. maybe they only do this to expedia clients, but i wont be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, well located”
Reviews.Author: Firebird5
Reviews.Content: Having never previously been to Canada let alone Vancouver, my wife and I booked our hotels and RV hire from the UK via Canadian Affair. This was their recommended hotel for Vancouver for our budget and, all in all, we were really pleased with it as a place in which to wind down for three days following our two-and-a-half-week tour of Alberta and BC. Arriving at the hotel by taxi in the early afternoon having returned our RV to the depot in the morning, we were greeted by friendly staff both in the lobby and at the front desk. Certainly, I was more than grateful to have a porter bring all our luggage up to our room - travelling with children is never a light affair! I would particularly complement Julie on the front desk for her manner with our kids and for the excellent advice on buses, ferries, attractions, etc. The room was much larger than we'd expected, even for a suite, with a spacious sitting area (two armchairs, couch, coffee table, TV with games console) and a comfortable bedroom with two double beds (and another TV). Separating these was a perfectly adequate galley kitchen (fridge with icebox, hob, oven, microwave, etc.) and a large bathroom. OK, the decor was a little dated, but the room was clean and perfect for our needs as we intended to spend as much of the final few days of our holiday as possible exploring the city. We did have a minor problem one morning when water came through the bathroom extractor vent from the room above, but this was dealt with by the maintenance staff quickly, politely and efficiently. The hotel is located very locally for such attractions as the Telus World of Science, the sports stadia and the False Creek ferries (which will take you to Granville Island, Kitsilano Beach, the Aquatic Centre and the Maritime Museum). However, it is a several block walk to the bus stop to get to Stanley Park. That said, for those who don't mind walking, the return walk along Robson Street past one of the most eclectic mixes of restaurants from around the world I've ever seen is quite worthwhile. There is a minibus service to the international airport which runs twice each morning. I don't think this is run by the hotel, but if you do need to get to the airport with a lot of luggage, then this is probably the best way to do so - it's quicker than public transport and much cheaper than a taxi. Despite the prices advertised in the lobby suggesting it would cost around C$40 for the four of us, the driver (who threw in a brief history lesson and guided tour en route) only accepted C$20 from us - bargain! All in all, I would have no hesitation recommending this hotel to anyone, but perhaps it is best suited to those travelling on a bit of a budget not looking for too much luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Very Central - Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: davmar70
Reviews.Content: We stayed 9 days here making it our home-away-from-home after the Alaska Cruise and beofre Rockies Train trip. So handy to everything, shop on site is ideal and 711 & IGA around the corner. Housemaid was lovely, staff great, we were so comfortable would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but will be staying somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: cupcakena
Reviews.Content: Average room but lovely staff. There were 3 of us staying in a one bedroom suite although I wouldn't really call it a suite and it would have been too small if we had stayed for any longer than 2 nights. The beds were comfortable but the pull out sofa was terrible. Location was brilliant but the room was a little dirty and the lifts were atrocious (normally I wouldn't even mention this on a review as I've never based my decision on the lift but this was ridiculous - try and get a room on a high floor or you'll be waiting a long time to get down in the mornings)

Reviews.Title: “Great value - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: weasle2
Reviews.Content: Had read some bad reviews about this hotel but decided to go with it because of its location and just hoped that someone had written the review when they were in a bad mood! It turned out that the hotel stay was great - staff were very friendly, accomodation was clean and well equipped. We had 2 one night stays - one before the cruise and one after - and like one of the other reviews on the second stay we were upgraded to a suite on the 20th floor! I would stay at this hotel again and would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there on a personal recommodation and thrilled I did”
Reviews.Author: Bobbiee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Robson for 2 one night stop-overs and found the apartment fabulous. They have a separate bedroom with two large beds, lounge, kitchen and bathroom. On our second visit we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite - even better! The beds are super comfortable and every 2nd floor has a laundry to catch up with your washing. The kitchen has all you need to cater for yourself if you're staying awhile and sick of restaurant food. I ordered a meal from the restaurant downstairs and picked it up myself to have in our suite - the meals in the restaurant are huge; enough for 2 folk actually! There is a mini 711 type store across the corner. I don't think the internet was free so I used the Public Libary opposite which is free for an hour. Would definately recommend the Rosedale on Robson (which is actually in Hamilton St)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: mumof2_10
Reviews.Content: I was a little unsure of this hotel as I had read some not so good reviews but crossed our fingers and went with it. What a great place! very friendly staff we arrived at 11:00 a.m. and our room was ready, it was clean and had enough space for 4 of us 2 beds in one room and a sofa bed in the sitting room the kitchen space was really all you need, unless your cooking a big meal. but for us worked great. Rosies was a good place to eat and a big thanks for storing our fish in your frezzer! the pool was a treat not many hotels with pools in Vancouver. We walked to most place the trolly tour stops across the street 3 blocks to sky train. the guest service desk sell tickets for almost everything! we will stay here again. Dont expect the westin on your beer budget!!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, not exciting”
