Reviews.Author: GillG_10
Reviews.Content: On the fringe of the shopping area & attractions, walkable to Yaletowtn, Gastown & shopping. We had 2 bed suite, very gloomy and rooms on the tired side with very noisy air conditioning. Restaurant at hotel not brilliant, but there is a free continental breakfast, which they keep very quiet about, in one of the meeting rooms. OK if you're not spending time in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good but basic”
Reviews.Author: Neil61a
Reviews.Content: The staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel furnishings are a little dated and the sauna didn't work. Internet charges are C$10 per day ...rip off. It is well placed for the Yaletown area and close enough to the Robson shop area...albeit the library area opposite the hotel is populated by down and outs in the evening. There is a nearby Budget car rental site which is useful

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure to stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kellybruce1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rosedale on Robson Street on three separate occasions during our Canadian trip for 26 nights. The check in was fast and easy and because we arrived early we could check in to our room straight away. The rooms were clean and exactly what we wanted with a good size gallery kitchen, nice size bathroom and everything was spotless. We could not complain about the housekeeping staff as they were fabulous and every staff member went out of their way to help us in anyway. I would recommend this hotel for any travellers who want a suite with a kitchen so they can make their own meals, especially at breakfast. The location of the hotel was perfect for us as we either walked everywhere or caught public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: EssexTripster
Reviews.Content: Checked in and found the reception staff very helpful and were very pleased to hear we had been offered a free upgrade on our room. The room we were given was very large and spacious and the kitchen in the room was well equipped. The hotel had a good location with only a few minutes walk to the restaurant and shopping district and a short walk to the waterfront. Although the hotel was busy, we were never disturbed by noise and got a good nights sleep. We were very pleased with our stay at Rosedale.

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver 2010”
Reviews.Author: ThomoLiverpool
Reviews.Content: I booked the Rosedale for 5 nights ahead of a two week stay with my family in Langley. The Rosedale is situated at the lower end of Robson, opposite the library. We found the location excellent, away form the hustle and bustle, but with acces to plenty of Food and drink bars. and located within easy walking distance to any attraction in downtown Vancouver. The hotel provided us with a Suite, kitchen/living area and large bedroom. Conditions were very good, view was perfect, all hotel people treated us well, and gave us an excellent service. For us it was the idea hotel, location and gave us time to relax before we met up with the family for the next two weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location”
Reviews.Author: Ozgypsay
Reviews.Content: This hotel met our needs; central yet still quiet location in Vancouver, spacious room, good housekeeping, and reasonable rate. Slightly annoying that we had to pay extra for Wifi and it was a terrible connection. Think we're getting our money back on that. No frills, but did the job nicely.

Reviews.Title: “Sofa bed great, Room okay, but ...”
Reviews.Author: BuccaneerDave
Reviews.Content: My impression and experience at the Rosedale almost mirrors sengi's review of July 12th. This was our second stay and the room is okay but needs a really good cleaning. On the surface everything was presentable but once you started looking closely it was in need of really thorough scrub. I slept on the sofa bed and was seriously not looking forward to it however surprisingly the bed was very comfortable (head at the foot end though) and I managed a fairly good sleep on it. The location is excellent especially if you are attending any events at the Garage or BC Place. All in all it's not a bad property and certainly worthy of consideration but only if the price is right!

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back to stay here anytime soon...”
Reviews.Author: INF0_4_u
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately our stay at the Rosedale in June 2010 was a huge disapointment. We expected it to be much better than it was. Especially because of the cost. They are an affiliate of a timeshare company in which we frequently use and they are supposed to have upgrade suites, so that was our reason for choosing the Rosedale. We requested a suite for 4 adults & they gave us what they told me was "the most updated 2 Br. Superior Suite" they have. The room decor was by far the most dated of any hotel I have stayed in the last 15 years. All the larger appliances were loud & old, the tv was small & out of date. We felt like we were staying in a dingy hotel on the wrong side of the tracks, rather than a nice suite in downtown Vancouver. We also found "Rosies", the pub downstairs to be a disapointment as well. They charge for internet service & as well as a nightly fee to park. The location of the hotel was good but for the price we defintely felt ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “location awesome”
Reviews.Author: poppynz
Reviews.Content: This suited our family of four perfectly. Comfortable (although bed on the firm side), with an awesome kitchenette. The huge floor to ceiling windows were just lovely to be able to see whats happening on the outside and let the natural light in. We were able to walk almost everywhere from here. First day we strolled down to hire bikes and biked the seawall and stanley park, hop-on hop-off bus just a 2 minute walk, library opposite, food places just surrounding the hotel. The pool and spa are clean and inviting with glass walls around the spa. We hired a rental car from budget - just a 2 minute walk away. Walked to Canada place to catch the float plane, walking to downtown shops and Canada Parade. All so convenient but without the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great staff, convenient...”
Reviews.Author: GBCheesehead
Reviews.Content: Nice place, great staff, convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbell1000
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the Rosedale on Robson four times now and haven't yet been disappointed. We booked with Canadian Affair each time and got brilliant deals. My most recent stay was with four other adults. We'd booked a double and a triple suite, knowing that the sofa in the living room could be converted into a double bed in the triple suite. When checking in we were informed that the triple room had been upgraded to a two bedroom suite, which was fantastic for the three sharing that suite. The decor is slightly dated, but everything is clean and tidy. Each suite comes with a living room, with tv, desk and phone. The kichen is fully equipped with a cooker, microwave, kettle, toaster and coffee maker, right down to oven gloves and washing up liquid. Very handy having the option to cook your own meals. There's a wide range of toiletries provided in the bathroom. During our last stay our bedroom had one large double bed (on a previous stay we had two doubles), a tv, desk and phone. There's also a small built-in wardrobe. The air con / heating system is easy to control. The hotel has a small indoor pool which I've never actually used, despite my good intentions! There's a lovely roof garden for chilling out in, and the hotel bar / restaurant, Rosie's, is great for breakfast, lunch and dinner. We ate breakfast there most mornings, which cost about $25 for two for two cooked breakfasts, fruit juice and coffee. The hotel is very handy to Downtown Vancouver. The shops, bars and restaurants are a short walk away. The new Canada Line Skytrain stations of 'City Centre' and 'Yaletown' are reasonably close to the hotel. We even walked, with all our luggage, to Canada Place to board our cruiseship, and also took a leisurely strole to Stanley Park. Fully intend to return to Vancouver again and can't imagine staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Well Priced, Good Service, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Calvan88
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed 4 nights at the Rosedale on Robson after completing a Sydney to Vancouver cruise. As we got off the ship at 9.00AM and were in the hotel lobby by 9.15AM, we were just expecting to drop our bags and go off until check in time, however, they checked us in straight away, no waiting around. The room(s) were large, clean with a small galley kitchen, perfect for making breakfast. Each odd numbered floor had a small guest laundry with one washer and dryer and you can buy the soap powder from Reception for a $1 a box. Hotel location is just a few blocks from the central shopping in Robson street. There is an IGA Supermarket with good pastry, breads and deli selection and a liquor store about 250 metres in Robson. Also, the area is well catered with small restaurants and take away food shops. There is also a reasonably priced Irish restaurant & pub with a good menu inside the hotel, which is great if you get back from a hard days sightseeing. Finally, although the check out time was extended to 12 noon (complimentary), they extended it again to 6PM if we paid another $80.00 which I thought was a great offer as our flight didn't leave until 8.30PM. Having stayed at the Pacific Pallisades on our previous trip, I thought the Rosedale was a great find and would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: ruby1026
Reviews.Content: Good value for a spacious room and had a nice stay, will return

Reviews.Title: “the very best”
Reviews.Author: heathchapel
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 using 3 rooms with ages of 70plus 2 /30 and 2/50s all agreed this hotel had it all rooms great facilities great . The people on the reception very helpful would go back again. The Rosies at the hotel we found very expensive for food / drinks also the bar shut dead on 23-00hrs.Try Earls in downtown for a good meal at a good price

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel and perfectly Situated for Everything”
Reviews.Author: SurreyCherry
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last week before and after a 5 day Alaskan cruise. We found it very central for visiting all the tourstist sites and restaurants and shops and very comfortable. Having the small well equiped galley kitchen was a bonus so that we could make coffee in the early hours, and we were very happy to return there for another night before our flight home. The staff were helpful - even finding us a room at 8.30 a.m.as one was available although the official time is 3p.m. We ate our breakfasts in Rosie's restaurant connected to the hotel but enjoyed exploring the many restaurants in theYaletown area close by. Try the new Skytrain, installed for the Winter Olympics, from the airport to central Vancouver. Cheap and very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but great location"”
Reviews.Author: kwitty
Reviews.Content: We just had a short stayover in Vancouver, and wanted to see the sites..so Rosedale fit that description....we weren't looking for luxury or service... Small rooms, clean and neat..that's all you can say...easy walk to Yaletown, catch the ferries to Granville...or do the sites...

Reviews.Title: “unhelpful staff, dirty, dated, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: runningm0m
Reviews.Content: I'm not really fussy about hotels and have stayed in several which have not had great reviews and been ok with them but this one was so bad I had to write something. I stayed here with friends for the BMO marathon. One of our group had stayed before and warned against it but we had friends in another suite so we stayed here to be with them. We paid for a room with breakfast but discovered breakfast started too late for us. When we politely pointed this out and asked if there was anything they could do for us instead, we were met with blank stares and a shrug of the shoulders. We called up to our friend's suite 8 floors directly above us and received a $1.25 + tax charge because their suite was a timeshare and was not part of the hotel. We had no warning of this when we went through the operator however and the staff would not remove the charge even as a gesture of good will. Our room was dark and was not helped out by the dark and dated furniture. There was visible dust everywhere. The bathroom even had hair in the corners and stains on the walls near the toilet - yuck! There were 3 of us in our room, for which we were charged an extra $25 but we had only enough towels and cups for 2. I even had to call down for a blanket for the sofa bed because we only had one, which was almost as thin as a sheet. The sofa bed itself was so old and worn that I could feel the frame through the thin mattress. I'm under 130 lbs so it couldn't be my weight. When we left, one of the elevators was out of service and we ended up walking down five floors with our luggage. Our night here was over $300. If you're going to spend that much to stay in Vancouver, don't spend it here!

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: ilovemauibigtime
Reviews.Content: I am not a picky person, I very rarely complain, but I feel that I was completely shafted by this hotel! I have stayed at many hotels with a so/so rating, and some with amazing ratings. This one, for over $200/night I was shocked!!! On the hotels actual website, they show pictures of fancy bedding, nice floors, comfortable beds etc, but what I got was completely the opposite. It was old furniture, old beds, hard as rock mattresses, terrible lighting. So, I called and asked if we could move to a different room. The person I spoke to was extremely rude saying there was nothing he could do for me and the rooms that are advertised on their website are on floors 20 and up! I was shocked that he wouldn't even take the time and say, "Let me see what I can do and I'll call you back..." It was an absolute "NO, Nothing I can do about it" attitude which blew me away. I will be taking my $200/night and spending it at the Sheraton Wall Centre where we are treated with respect! Oh...and they charge you for internet!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: iminlovewithmexico
Reviews.Content: Choose this hotel because of its location, hockey ticket packages and a recommendation from family. Staff was friendly and the Rosedale has a great central location. Would stay again in a heart beat! One thing about ordering to your room though is make sure you read the fine print - they add a 15% gratuity on to the price of the food so make sure you don't tip unless you want them to have more then 15%.

Reviews.Title: “The Rosedale on Robson Hotel was elegant and classy.”
Reviews.Author: kerrieluv
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the Rosdale on Robson Hotel and found it clean and comfortable and the staff were very friendly and helpful to us regarding tours, etc. and getting around the city. We had lovely views of the city and were near lots of attractions and transport.

Reviews.Title: “Wifi doesnt work in most rooms/areas of hotel, very noisy, double glazing awful!”
Reviews.Author: maritza_gee
Reviews.Content: The wifi only really worked in reception, and in corridors near the lifts, and because the hotel have an external contractor to provide it, they weren't very helpful when i complained, on numerous occasions. The hotel room overlooked the street, and the double glazing didn't work, so i ended up sleeping on the sofa as this was in the other room; Again, as they were full they didn't really care, even admitting that all the rooms are noisy anyway. Its a cheap, budget hotel, not geared up for businesses.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: AliKatChristchurch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel on two seperate occasions during our holiday and both times the staff were very helpful and friendly. The rooms are clean and tidy and it was good to have the kitchen as we had breakfast in our room before heading out for the day. It was also really handy to have laundry facilities available.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: CTSO
Reviews.Content: We had a one bedroom suite that had all one could want. Freshly decorated and new carpets. This hotel is great value for its location.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: Pankotor
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Very good location, friendly staff, good restaurant. Would go there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for extended stay.”
Reviews.Author: Soonie68
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great spot for extended stays. It is an all suite hotel and in my room, I had an oven, microwave, fridge and stove top. Perfect for the traveller who wants to save money on dining out. It is in a great location on Robson Street close to theatres and sporting events. It is a bit tired and could use some updating, plus the bed was not the most comfortable, but for the price and location, this is a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Location best thing about the Rosedale”
Reviews.Author: cynlouhoo
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd time staying at the Rosedale. The first time we were in a standard suite and we quickly determined we'd never do that again! The second time we spent more money ($30 I think) to stay in a Superior Queen suite, which was definately better.....this time we also opted for the Superior Queen, but we were a little more critical. In a nutshell, I think for the increase in price they should offer up better beds...the beds are old and uncomfortable (and squeeky) and are exactly the same as the standard room beds. The livingroom furniture is uncomfortable and ugly and the TVs are old and very small. There is only one ice machine on the 2nd floor....we were on the 20th floor....they do have ice cube trays in your freezer, but the ice had a disgusting flavour, probably from the ice tray soaking up various food smells from all the previous guests (ewww). The towels in our room were ugly mismatched brown things and not very large....and only a set of 2 (we probably could have requested extras). The bathroom is tight and needs updating. I had forgotten how the shower curtain blows in at you and that there isn't a nice curved shower rod. Also, you'd think they'd give you at least one housecoat in an "upgraded" room. In a nutshell, the view will be better in a superior room, but not much else.....and, if you are there for a concert you will not be hanging in your room looking out the window all day. Oh yeah, the continental breakfast ended at 9:30am the day we were there.....the morning after a concert is not the time to have to rush for breakfast! Building is not terribly secure either....don't have to use your room key to get from parking area or in the elevator. If what you want is great proximity to GM Place or BC Place at a relatively decent price, then you'll probably be happy here. If you are fairly picky (like I am), then for sure spend the $$ for the superior suite, but be prepared for it not to be "superior".

Reviews.Title: “Great central location...”
Reviews.Author: EmmaDurnford
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4-nights at the Rosedale on Robson from the 22-26 August 2009. This was the beginning of a month long independent tour of BC and Alberta - mostly staying in small B&Bs - and we were not disappointed with our first accommodation, the first of two hotels out of the total of nine places we stayed. I was a bit concerned prior to our arrival by other TA reviews regarding the refurbishment (or lack of) of the rooms but my concern was unfounded. We were allocated room 508 - a refurbished suite for two. The whole of the 5th floor appears to have been refurbished. The space was brilliant with a separate bedroom with kingsize bed (spare pillows and blankets in drawers). There was a galley kitchenette (fridge/hot plates and sink) with tea, coffee and milk which was very useful for a 'cuppa' in the morning. The bathroom was very clean with good toiletries, towels and flannels. There was a living area with writing desk and TV and a second TV in the bedroom. The rooms were serviced every day. The hotel entrance is actually located just off of Robson Street and I was expecting some noise as it is in the heart of Vancouver (there is also a firestation a few doors down). However it was fairly quiet, especially as the rooms are double glazed. As I am married to a fresh air addict the window was opened a little each night and despite being a light sleeper I had no problem, although some people might want earplugs to be on the safe side. The location is perfect for accessing Robson Street for shops (30 seconds!), Gastown (10-minutes walk) and Canada Place (15-minutes walk). There is a cash-point for Visa and Mastercards situated in the 7-11 on the corner of the street which is safe and has no charge for Nationwide Visa holders. There is a pool and jacuzzi along with some running machines etc. on the gound floor (to the left of the reception) which we did not use but looked clean etc. Breakfast is not included but Rosies is situated in the hotel and is good value. Our recommendation however is to have breakfast in 'Cafe Vancouver' a turkish cafe situated on the opposite side of the road next to the firestation. The coffee is superb and they have free WiFi access. We ended up there each morning having cinnamon muffins and pastries whilst catching up with emails. In fact that is the only downside of the hotel - is a lack of free internet access. The only way to access the internet was to register with an external company and pay by the minute. In this day and age I expect all big hotels to have internet capacity. However this is a small down-side and I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “One draw back”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMan37
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rosedale for 5 nights in Oct. The hotel is nicely located for visiting Vanc. The customer service A++ and the rate was good considering $99 night booked through expedia. Major drawback for me was the bed. It was extremely hard felt like I was sleeping on the floor. Asked for room change to see if bed was softer elsewhere. It wasn't got another hard bed. I stayed on the 9th floor #913 this side of the building is much more quiet than the #907 that I was switched to hoping for a softer bed. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel. A couple of things to add would be try to get up as high as you can due to the street noise and if the hard bed is an issue take the mattress from the sofa sleeper bed and put on top of your bed.

Reviews.Title: “This is a 3-star hotel -no more !”
Reviews.Author: Pudsig
Reviews.Content: This is an average hotel with an excellent location. Appears to be worn down and maintenance is apparently not a priority. The restaurant Rosies (read pub...) has too high prices compared to the standard. But rooms are nice and clean but with very noisy aircon.. The roof-garden (on 2nd. floor) is certainly not very charming - but of good use as a small refuge for smokers - which is a positive thing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Hotel, except for the HARD beds!”
Reviews.Author: hughcr
Reviews.Content: The only bad thing I can say about the Rosedale is that the beds are HARD! - Firm does not come into it. Saying that, everything else was excellent. The staff were helpful and friendly (well, except for the young lady on Sunday the 20th, in the morning - she needs a personality transplant!) The rooms were kept clean, with a great nod to being green, the location could not be bettered, and Rosies Bar gave good food and great service, quite reasonably.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: alanaher
Reviews.Content: Obviously, good location, just off Robson Street on Hamilton. Rooms are dated and studio is small. Carpets need to be replaced with tile, so that when cooking in close quarters of mini-kitchen, food stains can be easily cleaned up instead of staining carpet that has been there for far too long. Concierge helpful. Close to trendy Yaletown and old-town Gastown. Hop-on, Hop-off bus pick-up just across street by library - good for viewing city and finding out where everyting is though some buses need some shocks and brakes. Budget Car Rental just up the street from library. Rosedale high-end shopping district in walking distance. Decent pool and hot tub. Rosie's restaurant on grounds seemed pricey for breakfast. McDonald's just across Robson street good for take-out breakfast; a bit seedy to eat in. Enjoyed Milestones in Yaletown for drinks and dinner. Casino behind football stadium - not big, but lots of slots.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel depending on your room...”
Reviews.Author: darnley2005
Reviews.Content: I have read the other reviews on trip advisor and have noted the comments regarding the staff at the hotel. I'd like to start by saying how great they were from the front desk staff to the woman that cleaned the room. Always helpful and friendly I felt that they went out of their way to make sure I had a good stay. The rooms however, are something different. The reviews here clearly reflect what rooms you are assigned at check in. My first room had a terrible smell of smoke. I was therefore moved to another on the second floor. The second room was right above the bar and quite noisy. As it was match day this may have contributed to this. I was therefore moved to another room on the fourth floor. It was much quieter and a much nicer room which had more of an apartment feel. Both rooms on the second floor had no window for the lounge and felt slightly pokey. My room on the fourth floor had windows in both the bedroom and the lounge and felt much more spacious. Something definitely worth considering a request for at check in. In short a great hotel when you get the right room but get the wrong room and its awful. However, should you need to move rooms the staff couldn' be more helpful - so don't be afraid to ask... The staff at this hotel are their greatest asset - as a business traveller I stay in a lot of hotels and the staff here are amongst the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for centrally located hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Kirstied82
Reviews.Content: The room was a lovely size, with a kitchen/living area seperate to the bedroom,which was very handy with four girls travelling a great bonus. Laundry facilites are excellant, pool was really nice to have a swim. The staff could not do enough for us. highly recommened.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable Room, Friendly/Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: pdxian
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. It is right in the middle of everything in downtown Vancouver. It was a great "home base" from which to go sightseeing during the day, and then to come home to get ready to experience the night life in the evening. Very close to the art gallery, shopping, bars/clubs, and restaurants. The room I stayed in was very comfortable with separate living and bed rooms and a kitchenette in between. The views were spectacular (I was on the 17th floor). During my 3 day stay, I always felt "at home" when coming back to the room after a long day. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They were able to help me plan my sightseeing around town both with transportation and tips on where to go and where not to. Overall, this hotel helped to make my first trip to Vancouver a great one. I recommend this hotel to anyone looking to be in the heart of it all, who still wants the comforts of home!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: vacationer048
Reviews.Content: Disgusting I just returned from 7 days at the Rosedale via PTP Destinations. The room ( a suite) looked NOTHING like the pictures. It was dirty and dingy. The bathroom was moldy and filthy. I had to have them change the moldy shower curtain. The floor's veneer was peeling and they put down area rugs to cover it up which looked like they needed a good cleaning. The coffee pot had grinds in it from past occupants. The garbage cans were yucky. When I complained I was told that this is the only room available through PTP Destinations and that they put certain rooms aside for them. Probably the ones they don't want to clean or upgrade. When I spoke with a PTP representative, which is located aross the street from the Rosedale, the person, Cheryl Arnold, (she told me that she's the manager, although her business card states "Director") was so disinterested in my concerns and basically said too bad we are not going to locate a clean room for you at the Rosedale. Her response was also that there are "very few timeshares in Vancouver", so make do.She was so bored with my complaints about the room that I felt like I was keeping her up. DO NOT STAY AT the Rosedale and DO NOt go through PTP Destinations!! .

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience EVER!”
Reviews.Author: rockyandholly
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? My family went to Vancouver for a Holiday and we were expecting a decent/nice hotel, friendly staff, and a good stay...but we were very wrong. First off, the hallways reeked of fresh paint while we were walking to our room, but the paint still looked old and dull. The rooms are full of cluttered out-dated furniture, a kitchenette that would be suitable for a 70s mobile home, uncomfortable beds, gross shower curtains, and not to mention the annoying heaters that come on every 5 min and make rattle noises that keep you up all night long. To make it worse, at 8am on our day of check-out, housekeeping was knocking on our door asking when were leaving so they could clean the room. 8am in the morning? Come on! The staff are dishonest and have no clue what good customer service is, since after we left our credit card was charged hundreds of dollars more after we fully paid for our room. We got the money back after a long battle, but it sure ruined the rest of our Holiday. We only spent one night at this hotel, and one night was enough to assume that this hotel has no class and doesn't deserve anyone's business.

Reviews.Title: “Are You Kidding Me?”
Reviews.Author: adzonni
Reviews.Content: Seedy and seamy. Location is funked. Ready for this? : it's caught in a 1991 time warp. Breakfast roon has 1970s style conference chairs massive stains on the yuckie carpet there decaf coffee was packets nothing good for breakfast beds pretty hard like a 1995 HoJo AC uni t? sofa bed blocked bathroom access when pulled out kitchenette looks like something out of a bad 1980's movie vending machines funked adjoining restaurant is dark and hmmmm.... one bathroon for 5 people in a suite first time ever for that WHY DO PEOPLE LIKE THIS PLACE??? Plus the skinny on Robson Ave was that it's a real great world class street Get ready for the opposite ! also you pay for wireless at the hotel COME ON!

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: sharknes
Reviews.Content: This place is a great location and decent value. No real thrills but the staff is friendly and close to everything

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Shabby Interior”
Reviews.Author: Biztravler
Reviews.Content: Location is great, service was excellent, however the interior is sadly dated and in need of a refresh. The first room I was booked in smelled strongly of smoke, so if you are sensitive be sure to request a room on a floor that has always been non-smoking. Kitchette may be useful to families, not particularly useful for a business traveler. For the money, there are better options in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sauquoitr
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable unit with an excelent location--near lots of sights to see. Parking is on a fee basis

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: SAGreat09
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that understands overseas tourists - and I'm sure locals as well! We stayed here three times during our 4 week stay in Canada. Arriving via Japan early in the morning and were welcomed and given our room key. We returned twice. The rooms are more than adequate and we loved Rosies where we joined the locals in their support for the Canuks. We would return there any time.

Reviews.Title: “Great 8-night stay”
Reviews.Author: mmont69
Reviews.Content: This review after an 8-night stay should have more value than after a one-nighter or weekend. Suite: comfortable and roomy, big wall-to-wall and floor-to-ceiling windows gave huge spacious feel when drapes pulled back. Living room with one of the two TV's in the suite was handy when the wife didn't share my interest in the NBA and Stanley Cup finals. The door to the bedroom could be closed so as not to disturb madame's viewing of her chosen channel. Galley kitchen (kitchenette) was sufficient for our self-catering evenings-in. Huge fridge. All staff most helpful, cheerful and courteous - from chambermaid, dining room to front desk. Services made use of included the laundry and safety deposit box. Breakfast - continental, part of the package - basic but sufficient. As far as we were concerned, the most significant event of our stay occurred at breakfast one morning when a lady stopped by our table and introduced herself as a director of the hotel. Not only did she show a keen personal interest in ourselves, but she was interested to hear our answers to many questions she asked us about "her" hotel and obviously placed a good deal of value on them. We were not only impressed by the fact that this extremely busy lady spent some of her precious time in making herself known to us, and paying us the respect of valuing our answers to her questions. As if the first encounter wasn't enough, later in our stay she stopped by at breakfast once more and chatted and asked more questions, keen to know if and how our opinions had altered since our previous talk. Very impressive indeed. Onlt 3 stars given for Location, since for my 75-year-old legs the hotel is located a couple of blocks too far from the main CBD, though obviously it must be fine for the theatre and stadium. All in all, a most satisfactory stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Safe, Friendly, Comfortable, Convenient Spot To Rest”
Reviews.Author: Tourmite
Reviews.Content: For the past 9 years I have been the Queensland Leader of Groups to Canada/Alaska. Rosedale on Robson, Vancouver, British Columbia is our first port of call after arriving into the Airport after a long flight from Australia. This hotel is so safe, friendly, comfortable and convenient. We stay here 5 nights out of 23 during our tour and I cannot genuinely speak highly enough of the service given by all facets of the hotel staff to all my travellers. Catherine I Gear, Managing Director, Cross Country Tours, Brisbane, Australia www.crosscountrytours.com.au

Reviews.Title: “Always a good place to stay..”
Reviews.Author: Ann C
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay here, first was about 7 years ago and this time I think if anything the hotel was better than ever. It's an all suite hotel which gives just that extra space to move around, having a small kitchenette is really handy after a day out sightseeing and for breakfast too. There was a great grocery store, called Market Place not that far away for provisions. Not that far from Canada Place for cruise ship departures and all other shops etc within easy distance. Stanley Park was quite a way away but we still walked there.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Girls Weekend”
Reviews.Author: ChelseyWol
Reviews.Content: Four of us (Two adults, one teenage and one 6 month old) traveled to Vancouver for my best friend Birthday to watch a Canuks game in March. We chose to stay here because it's close to Robson, and close to GM Place. We had a room that had a living/kitchen area with a Hide-A Bed, and then a "master" bedroom with a King sized bed. This was perfect for us! There was a roof top balcony off the master bedroom. It was rainy the entire time we were there, so we didn't get to use the garden area, but it was really pretty to look out on. We REALLY enjoyed our stay! The cleaning ladies were great! They saw that it was a room full of women when we passed in the hall our first morning there, and they immediately, without being asked, left extra shampoos, soaps, and towels. The restaurant downstairs was very nice, the staff was friendly, and it was easy to get a cab when needed. Because of the great location, we mainly walked as we were pretty close to everything. We are already planning next years trip, and can't wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cel79
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night before our cruise in the 2 bedroom suite & then again in the same suite for 1 night after the cruise, I have no complaints what so ever. They let us check in at 9.00am which was fantastic, the restaurant Rosie's next door was great, they also have a indoor pool/hot tub as well as a gym. The rooms were very clean & spacious, the staff were polite & helpful. Would definetly reccomend!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but staff attitude really lets it down”
Reviews.Author: AlLeGrand
Reviews.Content: Four families travelled together to attend a wedding. Arrived near midnight after a long, delayed flight from London and check-in staff could not have been more unhelpful if they tried. No assistance with bags, no directions to elevators, floors, amenities etc. Questions were either ignored or met with mumbled replies. "Suites" were not small, they were tiny, particularly the bathroom which is definitely not for the claustrophobic! The complimentary breakfast was a joke and unless you were up very early, the muffins ran out very quickly. On the plus side, the rooms were clean and kept so throughout our 12-day stay. The bar & restaurant staff beat their front-of-house counterparts hands down being both friendly and efficient. Breakfast in the restaurant was excellent and reasonably good value. The hotel is conveniently located with plenty of shops, bars and resataurants and the football stadium all within easy walking distance. In fact, we walked just about everywhere we went due to a) the ease of navigation, b) the fantastic weather and, c) the guilt of over-indulgence making us want to take some exercise. Gastown, Chinatown, Stanley Park and many other areas of interest were all within an easy 20-30 minute stroll and when required, taxis were easy to find. Overall, it was probably worth the money for the location but the overall experience was definitely spoiled by the surly staff. Vancouver, on the contrary, is by far the best city I have ever visited.

Reviews.Title: “An positive experience all round.”
Reviews.Author: docajenk
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews on this accommodation we were a little concerned that it might be out dated and basic. On arrival we were pleasantly surprised. We were allocated a refurbished one bedroom suite (room 301). All the furnishings were tasteful and looked new. The lounge / kitchenette are compact, but had a very homely feel, the bedroom was a good size and had a rooftop garden which was very pleasant. The suite was very clean and well equipped. The pool / hot tub / steam room / sauna were all in working order and we enjoyed using them each day. If you are on a timeshare exchange / owner then you are able to have free DVD rental / games / books / internet access. The location of the hotel is perfect, just on the outskirts of Yaletown and walkable to all the sights in Vancouver as well as having lots of trendy bars / restuarants within 5-10 min walk. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. My only advice is make sure you request a refurbished room as the others are dated and in need of attention.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Overall”
Reviews.Author: DougHeather
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on business Feb 24 so i didn't have a great opportunity to see all the amenities of the hotel. Room was very nice, upgraded to a suite which I appreciated. The room was spotless and well appointed with a great TV in the living space and a smaller TV in the bedroom. The bathroom was small and a bit dated but the shower was great with lots of pressure and heat. The King bed was a little firm for me but that is personal taste. Lobby was good, staff were helpful and the attached pub had a great atmosphere. The only real downside was the continental breakfast which was quite possibly the lamest I have ever experienced. If all you want is toast or a Danish or a bowl of cereal then it will work, but the area is small and right beside the convention halls which made for some serious overcrowding. the location of the hotel is good with fairly close access to everything downtown. All in all well worth the money and a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: worldofviolets
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rosedale on Robson for 8 nights in January 2009 with a friend. Room was very clean and spacious and the beds were huge and comfortable. There is the option of having your sheets changed daily if you wish. The aircon unit was a bit loud but didn't cause me any problems sleeping. I couldn't get the wifi signal in my room but the wifi in the lobby was free. The pool was small and the steam room looked dirty and old, but the sauna was excellent as was the hot tub. The washers and dryers are on every second floor and I had to look on 5 different floors before I found a laundry room where both of them worked. The shampoo and moisturiser provided in the bathroom was good quality, which surprised me! Although the apartment has a kitchen, we didn't use it other than to make tea in the morning but it was useful to have a fridge for milk. The staff at the front desk were always very helpful when I had questions about transport.

Reviews.Title: “I just loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MorayTraveljunkie
Reviews.Content: Coming off the flight from Toronto we were surprised to find that the Rosedale is no longer on the list for the shuttle from the airport. We had booked and paid for the transfer in January and sometime after that the hotel had been removed. Since we had paid for the transfer it was cheaper to take the shuttle to the nearest hotel and get a taxi from there, which we did. The driver pointed us in the direction of the hotel and, being stiff from the journey, we decided to walk. After walking for some ten minutes, with two suitcases and hand baggage each, we decided we had had enough exercise and hailed a taxi. It turned out we were walking in the wrong direction! On arriving at the hotel a porter was waiting for a taxi and having comandeered ours asked if we wanted assistance in with our bags. We accepted gratefully and he walked off without the bags! Perhaps our Scottish accents confused him. After that everything went smoothly and we had a lovely stay for six nights in this, the third hotel of our Canadian trip. Registration in the small, basic, reception area was speedy and our suite on the fifth floor almost opposite the lift. There were 2 lifts, both in good working order and we never had to wait more than a minute for a lift. The suite itself was a little shabby but spotlessly clean and very comfortable. The lounge area that you entered from the corridor had no outside window but the lighting was adequate and one whole wall was mirror giving an even more spacious feel. The seating was comfortable and the television was there along with extra storage. We also found the most comprehensive hotel guide of all the hotels we have stayed in. The TV channels were listed, all the hotel amenities of which there were plenty, and advice on where the nearest convenience store and churches were. I can't now remember what all was in that guide but I do remember being most impressed at the time. A little galley kitchen led through to the bedroom area which had two huge beds. I was starting to get used to the size of the beds in Canada which all seem enormous to me. Lots of storage in the bedroom and a wardrobe for hanging clothes contained an iron and board. The kitchen had everything I needed and was equiped with washing up liquid and some basic tea, coffee and sugar. The little convenience store at the hotel entrance supplied all my needs for the week and the prices seemed quite reasonable to me. The bathroom/shower area was bright and spotlessly clean and there was a washing machine and drier on every second floor. I used both to freshen up my wardrobe for the next leg of our trip. Downstairs, off the reception area, is Rosie's restaurant. The food was good, the service cheerful, friendly and efficient and the prices reasonable and we ate there several times. The swimming pool looked enticing but I was always so busy either writing up my journal or planning/looking out the itinerary for the next day that I didn't get round to using it. We did chat to one family who shared the lift with us on their return from a swim and they said the water was quite cool but the pool area lovely and warm. I frequently do this, pick a hotel because of its pool then don't take the time to go for a swim! I loved this hotel. I felt very comfortable here and would go back. The only drawback was the 10 minute walk to the Chinese area or the 20 minutes it took to walk to the harbour area but this was hardly a drawback as we needed the exercise and we didn't even bother to investigate public transport or take a taxi which was not expensive. I loved Vancouver. We travelled on the Sky Train, a Float Plane, and the harbour ferry which was so well organised (enter one side, exit the other, waiting times never more than half an hour and displayed on a board in the waiting lounge) We were advised to get an all day transport pass for $8 and this was well worth it. We took a circular trip on the Sky train to see the suburbs, transferred directly to the harbour ferry where there were buses waiting for the ferry at the other side to take you to places like the Capilano Suspension Bridge and Grouse Mountain. All this and the return trip for $8. Well worth it! A super week in lovely comfortable accomodation!

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay after long Flight.”
Reviews.Author: Cheezel
Reviews.Content: We overnight stayed at this hotel after a long flight. It was well located and comfortable for our purposes. Would recommend it for convenience of location and proximity to attractions.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Place to Stay in Yaletown”
Reviews.Author: Three60
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the Rosedale. It is well located to take advantage of all of the attractions in downtown Vancouver and puts you on the edge of all the great food and lifestyle in Yaletown. We took in a Canucks game (tickets on game day from the conceirge) and the Ballet (theatre two blocks north). We had an upper floor suite which was clean, modestly appointed, comfortable. This isn't a hotel to be pampered in, but one that offers a comfortable stay at a good price. It is suprisingly dated for being a fairly new property. We used the pool everyday and appreciated how clean it was. Unfortunately, the hot tub was out of service for three of the six days that we were there. When everyone was checking out on Sunday morning, the elevator service took forever. Breakfast was a bonus. It had all of the basics (toast, danish, fruit, yogurt, cereal, juice, coffee). Nothing fancy but a solid start to the day.

Reviews.Title: “convenient”
Reviews.Author: stpoint
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 8th floor in a timeshare unit and were pleasantly surprised. We had a main bedroom with galley kitchen, bathroom and sitting room. The unit is small but was very suitable for the three of us, anymore would have been crowded. The staff were excellent. Rosies bar was ok for food. The vancouver area is a construction site at the moment. The hotel was central for everything and we would stay here again. it is a 3 star motel, so if you dont expect the ritz you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Rosedale on robson”
Reviews.Author: Waynebt
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel. The room had a sitting area with an internal door shutting off the bedroom with two large beds. Great if you have kids. The aircon system was the best of six hotels we stayed in including two Delta chain hotels. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Rosedale Bouquet”
Reviews.Author: dObbie0
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rosedale on three separate occasions during our recent Alaskan/Canadian trip. We found it comfortable and within walking distance of all public transport, and yes the breakfast arrangements are a disaster! However, the shops are close and we found we didn't need to use the Rosedale eating areas. Also each room has a kettle as well as those silly coffee makers, which we certainly didn't find in other hotels. The best experience though were the upgrades we received each time we booked in. By booking three we had a large,fantastic apartment. We would definitely stay there again, if only to see what sort of upgrade we'd get next time!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: PADIsandybottom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aviawest timeshare portion of the Rosedale on Robeson August 23-30, 2008. Hotel room consisted of a sitting area, galley kitchen, bathroom and bedroom. Bedroom was a corner unit with views of Grouse Mountain to the north and Granville Island to the south. Unit was clean throughout and perfect size for family of four (although the kids had to decide whether they would sleep together in the pull out bed or separately on the floor). The pool is small and not worth the time. On the second floor, the hotel has a free continental breakfast with delicious pastries and great coffee and fruit smooties. Kitchen was stocked for cooking meals and all utensils and dishes/pots/pans were in good condition. The property is well maintained, and Rosie's restaurant (located on the ground floor) has good food and good local beers. The hotel is perfectly located to get to Stanley Park and the Sea to Sky Highway, or south to Tswassen for the ferry to Victoria. Best part was the ability to walk to Yaletown (Yaletown brewery is awesome, as is PHAT deli--you must have the montreal steak there (wash it down with a Dead Frog Ale) and their breakfast is absolutely fantastic).

Reviews.Title: “great location for seeing vancouver”
Reviews.Author: gerrydw
Reviews.Content: stayed here in may 08. for my wife, myself and our 3 yearold son this hotel could'nt have worked out any better. the staff were excellent, helping in any way possible. the resturant (rosies) is definatly worth a visit or 3 in our case. really for the money it is fantastic value. we are going back to vancouver in october, and yes we are staying at the rosedale. many other hotels could learn a thing or two from the rosedale. thanks and look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: bedlingtonsharks
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 20th to 23rd August at the beginning of our Canadian adventure. Firstly, the price charged for the room was very reasonable and considered good value for money. My wife and I and our two kids stayed on the 9th Floor. Whilst construction work was going on around in preparation for the Winter Olympics, we never heard any - although every time the Fire Department are called out to an emergency, we were awaken by the sirens as the Fire Station is only 100 metres away. Don't let this put you off though. The rooms size was good although the layout could be better - the 'living' area and 'sleeping' rooms should be reversed so that you're not sleeping next to the windows. The beds were poor quality and creaked every time we moved. The room was serviced daily and to a good standard. The front desk staff were fine and the concierge even arranged tickets to our first ever Football Game - the BC Lions v Calgary Stampeders. The stadium is within a 'stones-throw' of the Rosedale and it was a great experience well worth the money. One other negative and perhaps one that the hotel management should seriously consider. We were charged (as were the other guests) $11 plus tax per night for underground parking. For this, I'd expect some form of security for the money yet this was not apparent and indeed the vehicle parked overnight next to our hire car was targetted by thieves for their Satellite Navigation System. Do not leave anything in the vehicle of any value! Overall though, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with the rosedale”
Reviews.Author: Mar60
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rosedale 02/08/08 to 09/08/08. Had a very pleasent time. Lovely suite and plenty of room for 2 adults and 3 children. Staff very friendly and helpful. Toy chest at reception very popular with my children. Pool well appreciated after long days out sightseeing (However the bottom is extemely rough for some reason and my niece cut her feet several times)?? The cleaning staff did a lovely job tidying up for us everyday and as a busy full time working mum, I really appreciated this break from housework!!!. I never managed to find the washing machines though?? Good location and withing easy walking distance of all transport facilities. Highly recommend for families and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Olraku
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, literally 15 min. walking to waterfront (Seabus terminal). There is a lot of construction going on in the area, but we have not heard any noise from the construction site in our room. We stayed 3 people in the room, which had 2 queen beds and a pull-out couch, which turned out to be a really comfortable to sleep on, 2 TVs, ok size bathroom. Furniture etc. seemed to be new. Breakfeast is complimentary and given that couple of muffins, tea and coffee I consider adequate. The staff was ok apart from the fact that when our business partners called us from overseas, they were informed we already checked-out which was not the case. Also, be aware that when you check out and want to leave you bag with a consierge, you will have to pay 1 CAD, this I consider extremely cheap on the hotel's part, but oh well... Given the great rate we received from Orbitz, I still rate this hotel above averge and would definitely stay there again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Due to building work not a good location...............”
Reviews.Author: julie053Uk
Reviews.Content: My husdand and I have just returned from a tour of Canada and we spent the last 4 nights at this hotel. Our room was super as all the rooms are suites and ours had recently had new carpets etc. Hovever its location currently leaves a lot to be desired., Due to Vancouver holding the winter olympics in 2010 there is an awful lot of building work to be finished and this hotel is right in the middle of it. The surrounding streets are incredibly dirty and there is rubbish everywhere. Also there were a lot of homeless men rummaging through rubbish and asking for money! We definitely had to think carefully about where we were walking! Also some of the surrounding shops and cafes are quite 'tacky'.The indoor pool is only a small 'lap pool' and some of the staff were quite abrupt. If you can afford it stay at the Westin Bayshore - it has a superb location and I wished we had paid just that little bit extra!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but ...”
Reviews.Author: marsupilami
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel though its location is great for shopping and other activities downtown. We did not appreciate the presence of cockroaches in our hotel suite.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with the rosedale”
Reviews.Author: Autumn23
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a reasonably priced hotel in downtown Vancouver to stay at prior to our cruise ship departure. This hotel is in a very nice area of downtown. It was within walking distance of pretty much everything. Vancouver does have some seedy areas, but we felt very comfortable here. Hotel was very clean and is in the process of updating their decor. Would highly recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: froggnik
Reviews.Content: Good overall value for Vancouver. Dog friendly without smelling like it. Small kitchenette and living room area, secure parking. Close to BC Place and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Good city base”
Reviews.Author: Fay99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rosedale before and after an Alaska cruise, six days in all. It had everything you could want for a city based stay and the staff were really friendly and helpful. We stayed in a 13th floor room initially which certainly would have given vertigo sufferers a problem with the floor to ceiling window. We loved the city views though. We loved Vancouver and the Rosedale was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location only”
Reviews.Author: BBAB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Rosedale on Robson from June 4-8, 2008. The hotel is average. The staff were really friendly and helpful. The lobby was dreary and old. Repairs were being done in front of the elevators- a real eye sore. We never found the elevators to be slow, just really old looking. The hallways are old looking and musty smelling. Our room was ok. It had astrange double door . when you opened the first door , there you saw your room and someone else's. Strange. The room was again, outdated but fairly clean. The view was very nice. Looking out you could see lots of beautiful terrances with flowers. Out of our window side we could see and HEAR fire engines every night. We think theres a fire station across the street from the hotel. The best thing about this hotel is the location. You just can't beat it. Walking distance to all areas, attractions and resturants in the city. Beware there is a high number of homeless and /or drug addicted persons. The cab driver told us this is a really safe city and that you could walk anywhere at night. Don't believe it! I'm from Toronto and downtown Vancouver is bad, worse than Toronto. In spite of some negatives ,the price was right and the location awesome- we would stay at the robson again. oh and there is a 7 eleven across the street and a Starbucks on every corner, we liked that!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: BANDW
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the end of a 20 day trip across the Rockies. The hotel was great, nice rooms - good location

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: OutbackAussie
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 days prior to our cruise. The hotel was excellent location and close to the library, where there was a bus stop for the Hop on Hop off tours.The bar & restaurant at the Rosedale was excellent ,we dined there for every meal. Excellent meals & very reasonably priced. Within walking distance to the shops on Robson St. Small taxi fare to cruise terminal.

Reviews.Title: “canadian holiday 2008”
Reviews.Author: cath_and_rob
Reviews.Content: suite with kitchenette area, clean with everything you could need. we were on the 18th floor and near a vent shaft, this caused a humming noise all night that irritated my partner but not myself. parking available at $11 per night. staff not the friendliest we had encountered but the hotel itself is worth a stay. excellent value food at Rosies rest. attached to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our second visit to the Rosedale”
Reviews.Author: Whale-Watchers
Reviews.Content: We love Vancouver and returned to the Rosedale for the second time. We were welcomed with an upgrade and had surprise views of snow-capped peaks through high-rise blocks. Reception staff were warm and efficient, going out of the way to provide maps and information. Our suite had everything we needed and the complimentary hot drinks, muffins and pastries each morning were a scrummy bonus. We stayed five nights and easily filled our days, taking public transport to Grouse Mountain, Granville Island and walking the fabulous Stanley Park. All in all, a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay in an older hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Mijasab
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 8 nights. We found the staff to be pleasant and helpful. The lifts were very slow. It is an older hotel with comfortable but older furnishings. At the time we were staying there they were painting the lobby area. It is a great location being in walking distance to Gastown, Yaletown, ferry to Granville Is., Subway and Robson Street shops. The two bedroom suites were a good size for us (4 adults and 2 children). The kitchen facility was average but we seemed to be able to use it on a regular basis. We were able to cook every night using the oven, cooktop and microwave. My parents car was broken into the night before we were leaving. It was parked in the basement carpark of the hotel. There was no gate into the carpark. The hotel gave them free carparking for the their two week stay. There is a firestation across the road from the hotel therefore expect a bit of noise on weekend stays. The hotel facilities were good. There is a pool, spa and gym available. Also laundry facilities on every second floor ($1.25 per dryer and washer). Rosies Restaurant downstairs was very nice. The margaritas very nice also.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: noddyandbigears
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in the rosedale with its spacious suites. The location was good and it was easy to walk to many attractions. The laundery facilities were on every other floor which meant they were easy to use and the buffet breakfast good. The only downside was that when we used the pool the water was quite cool.

Reviews.Title: “The worst experience I've had in a Vancouver hotel”
Reviews.Author: vancouverislander
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 2 bedroom suite for one night to attend a Springsteen concert. Booked 3 months ahead, requested an early check in as one person in a wheelchair who needed a rest break before concert. Arrived 30 minutes ahead of check in, room was not ready. No parking for a van-(didn't fit in underground.) Desk clerk was not friendly, told us to speak to valet about parking, valet directed me on map to a parking lot 4 blocks away. 1 hr later, after hoofing it to park a disabled person's wheels, our room was ready. Upon entry, it reeked of cleaner, wonder what it was covering up? Website shows a spacious layout, WRONG!, actually 1/2 the size, very dated furniture, nothing matched, dark and dingy. At bedtime, the beds were the worst ever slept on- very old mattresses, saggy, no springs, like cardboard covered cement. When attempting to exit hotel lobby for concert, a workman had his ladder set up on the disabled person ramp. When politely asked to move, he was very surly. Nice touch ! Use elevator at your peril. Long wait and for us it broke down, stopped between floors and had to use emergency phone to get door open. Staff on check out were nicer but too late, I will never ever darken the door of this cheap overrated dump again.

Reviews.Title: “a good choice”
Reviews.Author: lozzdog
Reviews.Content: We had a great 5 days here in a two bedroom apartment. We are a family of 5 so we neede to utilise the sofa bed. The apartment was very clean and comfortable - extremely well located. Complimentary Coffee & Pastries/muffins available on 2nd floor meant we did not have to organise breakfast. Although it was a little cramped it certainly beat having 2 hotel rooms - cheaper too. We would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bertie748
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel with our 2 grown daughters and thought it was a good clean suite. There are 2 seperate bedrooms one with a queen bed, the other with 2 singles. There is a small lounge area with t.v couch etc and a kitchenette. The bathroom is of a standard size but clean. The location of this hotel is great, within walking distance to most tourist sites. The restaurant downstairs offers good breakfast and other meals at a reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “little bit out of it”
Reviews.Author: TinaF
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for 3 nights at the end of our honeymoon in August. I found the hotel a little bit out of it by that I mean it was a good 15-20 mins walk to everything which was hard when it was hot and we had a 7 year old with us. I also found Vancouver at night very frightening with pan handlers everywhere. Fantastic in the day. Stanley park and the Aquarium are definatly worth a visit. We ate in gas town the first night at the old spagetti factory after having a great meal at the one in Banff. Well it was not at all like that, very disapointing. The second night we got a take away from China Town and it was fantastic. We ate it in our room which had a kitchenette and lounge area. The 3rd night we ate in Earls after eating in the one in Whistler. This was good. The hotel its self is a little dated and the lifts are a nightmare 1 was not working and they seem to stop on every floor. There is a lot of construction in Vancouver and all we could see from our hotel room was cranes. Quite a dark room in the lounge but the bedroom was ok. I would look for a differnent hotel if going back to vancouver. I can highly recommend grouse mountain and the capalano suspension bridge. Great day out.

Reviews.Title: “Good Again”
Reviews.Author: GLGB
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Rosedale while in Vancouver to take in a Canucks game. We had stayed at this hotel a couple of years ago so we knew what to expect and were not dissappointed. Our room was on the 18th floor with a great view of the downtown are. Our room was lots big enough, clean and quiet.The small kitchen area was good for the late night pizza after the game, and the front sitting area buffers any hall noise from the bedroom area. It is an easy 5-10 min walk from GM Place and handy to Robson Street shopping if you are so inclined. Taxi to the bus depot ran us about $7.00 for our departure to Vanc. Island. Our only complaint, albeit minor was the slow elevators in the hotel. For the price, we will definately be back here.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised”
Reviews.Author: fairweatherfriend
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights before going to Victoria and 2 nights on the way back and we were really pleased with our rooms. It was clean, warm. comfy and spacious. We had fantastic views across the city and the staff were really helpful. We were able to leave some of our luggage as we were returning and didn't want to take it all to Victoria on the coach and boat. We also left luggage at the hotel on our last day before returning back to the UK and the staff booked our taxi for us so it gave us the day to see more of Vancouver. Have to say that the hotels website does not do it justice and that we were aprehensive but would definetley book again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Buddy74
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Rosedale on Robson in May 2006 for a week while holidaying around Canada. We found the rooms to be well equiped with seperate bedroom, lounge area and kitchen facilities. It was also helpful having laundry facilities available on every other floor. Staff were friendly and the hotel well priced for what we received. Located in a good part of the City and only short walk to Chinatown and historical Gastown. Would definately stay at Rosedale on Robson again.

Reviews.Title: “apartment style for motel room price”
Reviews.Author: jel79
Reviews.Content: why stay in a small motel room when you can get a 1 bedroom suite for the same price? On trendy Robson st, a short walk to anywhere. very clean, spacious and extremely quiet. We were in a room directly opposite the lifts and barely heard a sound. Room is equipped with cooking facilities so we ate in after wandering around the markets and buying fresh local produce! the motel provides muffins and tea/coffee in the morning, but anything more you need to buy - but you dont really need to! Bed was heaven at the end of a busy day - so comfortable and spacious! We now look for suites instead of motel rooms after being spoilt here!

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected”
Reviews.Author: exdancer
Reviews.Content: I was so worried about the rooms after reading some bad reviews, but it just goes to show that some people are picker than I am. We had 2 suites one for us and the other for the other couple we invited to join us. We booked our rooms with RCI not with the hotel. The hotel does not check you in the Aviawest office checks you in - which is adjacent to the hotel. The Aviawest staff are very friendly and helpful. Leonard made some recommendations for dinner and other activities. The rooms were very clean, there are enough towels for 3 days (there is no maid service with RCI) although if you needed more towels just dial zero - the phone rings at the Aviawest office and they will bring towels immediately. The windows are great - they are floor to ceiling. There were some reviews that complained about the size of the kitchen (why on earth do you need a full size kitchen) the galley kitchen is plenty. It had a stove, mirco wave, refrigerator, nice coffee maker, all the utensils you MIGHT need. There are so many fabulous restaurants in Vancouver why would you want to cook anything? Downstairs there is Rosies which offers a good breakfast plus there is a Starbucks on every corner. The Rosedale is a perfect location and everything is in walking distance..Yaletown, Gastown, Granville street and good shopping. We drove to Whistlers - it snowed, it was beautiful. We took the harbour cruise, Capilano suspension bridge and the tree top adventure was the highlight for us. Anyway take a look at the photos I took it they say it all - the rooms and the sights.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: Beachie84
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights before heading up to Whistler. Staff were very helpful and friendly, location was great, room was quite basic but clean, comfortable and catered to our needs. Restaurant was lovely and 'homely'. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable suite, good location”
Reviews.Author: kdtc
Reviews.Content: My 2 friends and I (all singletons) stayed in the Rosedale on Robson for one week. The hotel staff were very friendly, the Airport had a paid direct transfer bus which was very convenient. Door staff were very helpful if stuck on directions. The hotel had laundry facilities on every other floor and were cheap to use, although for a week stay I would buy own detergents. I found laundry facilities to be very useful, when I moved onto another suite hotel I missed this very much. The hotel is in a very good location, 5-10minutes walk to Chinatown and 10-15minutes to Gastown. Yaletown is 5mins walk down the road and the Cinema and IGA Marketplace is 10mins in another direction. Granville Island was easy to get to as well with the boats 5mins walk from Yaletown. Robson street is full of shops and popular brands with a couple of shopping malls in close vicinity. It takes about 20mins to walk from the hotel to the end of the shopping end of Robson Street. Stanley Park is a very short Bus trip away. Rosie's Restaurant and Bar had very friendly staff (In fact all staff members in shops in Vancouver are friendly!!) the food was also good but Rosie's tends to be full of tourists naturally as it is attached to the hotel. My friends loved the Swimming Pool, Jacuzzi and Sports centre and were regulars everyday, sometimes twice a day! The suite was very clean, there were two tv's, one in living area and one in bedroom. There was no noise and the A/C was controlled by ourselves which was very good. Windows also opened which I appreciated (even from the 12th Floor!). Bathroom was also very good, bright, high pressure shower, rails and door hooks. Kitchenette area had a microwave, very large fridge and crockery, cutlery and tea towels. Electric cooker was very useful for cooking own lunches, dinner or snacks. The maid service was also very good. One negative - not enough hangers in the wardrobe! As there were 3 of us in a room, I did not find it crowded as there were two double beds and the sofabed in living area turned into another bedroom at night. I had a great stay in Rosedale and would go there again. Places to visit: Must do a bicycle ride in Stanley Park. Must do Whistler. Grouse Mountain - very disappointed, can take it or leave it. Capilano Bridge was better than expected even with the high entrance cost. Dim Sum in Chinatown was great and very cheap. Chinatown was like little Hong Kong stuffed into a few streets. Note: There is a particularly dodgy part of town on the edge of Chinatown. As a group of 6 people from east London, we still felt rather uncomfortable. East Hastings Street on the North-east side was most definitely an eye opener! Don't even think about it at night!

Reviews.Title: “Met Our Needs”
Reviews.Author: Fonzmambo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and two young children in the Aviawest (timeshare) portion of the hotel for 5 nights in July. Our room was a one bedroom suite which had a main bedroom housing a king bed, one chair, a small dresser, a small desk, a TV, and a very small closet. A small hallway with a minikitchen (stove, small fridge, microwave, cabinets) separated the bedroom from the living room. The living room had a pullout double couch (NOT comfortable for an adult, but my five year old slept on it no problem), a couple of lamps, small desk, small dresser, and a TV. The bathroom was small, but clean, and had a shower/tub. My only concerns with the room were 1) very poor water pressure in the shower, 2) limited number of towels and they were small and flimsy, 3) room was a little worn out, with worn carpeting and looked like it hadn't been updated for a while, 4) our room faced a large construction site where building began at 6 a.m.! This made for very early wake-ups every day... We spent a lot of time in the hotel pool, which is indoors. It is small, but big enough to play around in. There is also a hot tub, a steam sauna, and a dry sauna in the pool area. The exercise room is right next to the pool and is very small, especially for a hotel of this size: there are two treadmills, a broken exercise bike, a recumbant exercise bike, and a stairstepper. The hotel itself is right smack in the middle of downtown, and we walked anywhere and everywhere we needed to go, including Stanley Park, Granville Island, Gastown, and all around the downtown area. We are very active in general, however, so people with limited walking ability or poor tolerance may not do as well. There are tons of restaurant options nearby, including a cafe/bar in the hotel itself. There is also a small store right next door to the hotel which offers a limited number of groceries and personal care items. Public transportation is abundant and easy to access from the hotel. I found the Aviawest office as well as the hotel front desk to be very helpful with information on local sightseeing and directions. One item of note for those who stay in the timeshare portion of the hotel is that housekeeping does not tend to your room if you stay less than 7 days. Consequently, we accumulated a ton of trash (which my husband would slyly dump into the housekeepers trash bag when she was servicing the room next door) and we had to keep reusing our flimsy little towels for both pool and showering use. BUT...these were minor issues and we had such a lovely time in Vancouver that we could easily overlook these setbacks.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Birthday to me !!”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Carter
Reviews.Content: My partner treated me to six nights here for my 50th birthday - the highlight being a whale watching trip on the actual day. I hadn't stayed in this style of accommodation before (suites) but was impressed by the amount of space in our room with separate lounge area. Even had two TV's although didn't switch either of them on ! Whilst we didn't use the cooking facilities the kitchenette was useful for making ourselves breakfast and drinks and the fridge kept us supplied with ice for our early evening cocktails before hitting the bars and restaurants. Enjoyed undisturbed use of the swimming pool, sauna, steam room and jacuzzi (only saw two other people in there during our stay). Ideally would have preferred a room higher up but even then I don't think the views would have been that great due to location, proximity of other blocks and the amount of construction going on locally. Very easy and cheap to get to by public transport from airport (bus 424 and change to 98-B line (get off at Seymour & Smithe stop 3.25 CAD). Good location - an easy stroll along Robson to the bars on Granville Street. Only a couple of blocks away from loads of bars in Yaletown (Yaletown Brewing Company at 1111 Mainland Street a favourite especially for their cheap Sunday beer promotions !!). Irish Heather in Gastown and Carderos and Mill Marine on Waterfront regularly frequented during our stay too. Food highlights - "Legendary Noodles" at 1074 Denman Street and The Sequoia Grill in Stanley Park where I celebrated my 50th where we had the best table in the restaurant, watching the sunset over English Bay with one of the best meals I have ever had anywhere in the World. Rosies downstairs OK for good filling fodder. Not so lucky with an Indian meal - unfortunately mistook the "Flavours of India" for the "Taste of India" (apparently recommended) a few doors further on along Robson.Quite simply the most bland virtually inedible curry I have ever had. Biggest disappointment was Grouse Mountain. Very expensive for what it was. Lumberjack show a bit of fun and birds of prey display quite interesting but bears seemed to spend most of their time hiding and advertised wolf enclosure didn't appear to exist along with non-operating chair lift. Vancouver is a great city (second visit) but you will soon see why it is so green. One of the locals jokes is "What do you get after two days of rain ?" "Monday".

Reviews.Title: “You can't believe all you read”
Reviews.Author: denkath
Reviews.Content: Before leaving Australia, after reading some of the reviews I hadn't slept for weeks worrying about this establishment as we were coming back to here after our Evergreen Tour for 2 days as well as before and during the Tour. Well, I could not believe the rooms and suites we had. EXCELLENT everyone of them. Staff very helpful and shopping right at the door for those little things as well as good shopping just a few blocks away. So for us, we could not say anything negative about the place or it's proximity to all that a tourist would need in Vancouver. Rosie's was a nice place to eat with good portions. All in all the Rosedale and Vancouver was tops on our tour .

Reviews.Title: “We liked it”
Reviews.Author: Wilmott
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just outside the popular hotel belt but convenient to a Skytrain station. All the rooms are spacious with a separate sitting room and with a kitchenette and bathroom . There is a large construction site across the hotel but did not disturb us at floor 13. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: navaro
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from Canada tour with 2 nights before and 2 nights afterwards at this hotel. Reception staff friendly and helpful, and able to store luggage for the day if needed. Roomy foyer and good central location. Room had basic cooking facilities, including hot plates and fridge. Room service also available, and 727 store directly across road.
