Also Macdonalds, and good internet cafe open late and quite cheap. We really liked the hotel restaurant, and the bar - Rosie's. Food was well priced, good large serves. We ate there four times! Got very busy on Hockey nights as Stadium close by but atmosphere friendly and beer good. Would stay at this hotel again, especially if you like being able to use your own kitchen facilities even just occasionally.

Reviews.Title: “Great Options”
Reviews.Author: wanderer1703
Reviews.Content: As an RCI member I exchanged my timeshare week for this property. The staff were great-very helpful with all kinds of information. The location was prime-close to theaters, sports arenas and famous Robson Street shopping and dining. The 2 bedroom suite was cozy to be sure, and even though they say it sleeps 6 that would really be pushing it. Even with 4 people you would need to be very tidy in the common areas in order to function. But the minikitchen had everything you could need for preparing basic meals and snacks, but with the close proximity of some affordable restaurants-there was no need. One problem was the bathroom-lack of towel bars to hang wet towels could be a problem if more than 2 people are staying in the room. Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay if you know a couple of things...”
Reviews.Author: letterdude
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rosedale, recently, as part of a concert package deal (Eric Clapton!). These kind of event/accommodation packages are this hotel's specialty. Owing to the proximity to downtown Vancouver, and most of the city's major venues, it's a good bet for seeing the sights. Unlike some of the previous reviews, we found our room to be quite enjoyable. Maybe not a 5-star, but a high 3-star anyway. We weren't in town for the hotel, in any event! The service was excellent. Housekeeping was very prompt in bringing extra bath towels and did a great job on taking care of our room. Check-in was easy due to our decision to arrive a day before the concert. As noted, because the hotel offers these packages, event days will see lines for reception, elevators and tables in the pub/restaurant (Rosie's). Factor that into your schedule and make appropriate plans. We booked into a corner room on the 17th floor. While the room was quiet, the height helps by being away from street noises and the view of downtown Vancouver was pretty cool. The pool is, basically, a lap pool with a bit of a wider portion at one end for splashing with the kids. There is a small exercise room with standard hotel equipment. For some reason, I didn't end up using it, after the concert! While the room was a little dated, staff were in the process of renovating, on a room-by-room basis. Even with that, the fact that we had a separate living room made it enjoyable when we had friends visit. The corner room meant that we had large windows in both the living room and bedroom. Overall, this was a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Unfair”
Reviews.Author: tdbr1
Reviews.Content: There are a couple of reviews before me that I found very unfair. I am an RCI member and as such realize that the Hotel and the RCI are two seperate entities. RCI as our time share company owns suites in the Hotel which are operated from a seperate desk, the hotel has no control over our suites. So it is not fair to judge the hotel itself if we are not happy with RCI service. I have always found the Rosedale to be a very comfortable and pleasant Hotel to stay at, even before buying my time share with RCI. Yes the suites are a bit small but lets face it when your visiting how much time are you really spending in the rooms? For the people who complained about getting two suites rather than one, as I have had the same thing happen before, did you check with your travel agent to make sure they had booked what you wanted or just blamed the hotel because they are the ones who gave you what the agent had booked. So to close I would say that you can not always blame the hotel for a bad experience. Remember Rosedale and RCI two different companies and just because you have had a bad day it is not always the hotels fault.

Reviews.Title: “Below par”
Reviews.Author: cottonandwool
Reviews.Content: Advertised as a family hotel, the rooms are smallish for 'suites'. No windows in loungeroom making it dingy and claustrophobic. Kitchenette is OK for making cereal but not much more. Forget the muffins provided in the 2nd floor lounge. They were hard, dry and tasteless. Bathroom very small. On site restaurant was closed on New Years night from 9pm and No room service available even though guests were still arriving off international flights and hungry. Didn't see staff smile once. Booked a 2 bedrrom suite as travelling with kids and was instead given 2 x 1 bedooms with no interconnecting door even though booked 6 months in advance. This meant 1 parent in each room. Had already booked and paid to go back 10 days later for an overnight and asked that they make sure we get the 2 bedroom suite as requested. Yet again put us in 2 x 1 bedrooms. Too many negatives, not enough positives, Would never darken their doorstep again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: summitsw
Reviews.Content: We'd stayed here before when we took a trip in 98, but were disappointed this time. Arrived at 5pm after 24 hours of travel from Australia and were given our room, got a corner one bedroom suite which was a little cramped, had to move the furniture to pull out the sofa bed. All of us wanted a shower of-course, but it didn't work properly, water came out of the bath spout as well. Rang down to front desk (Doug, not terribly helpful!) and were told someone would come up to fix it, we also asked for extra towels, shampoo etc since there were three of us. After half an hour rang back down since no-one had come up. Housekeeping finally arrived then the maintenance guy, he couldn't fix the shower but said it would be fixed the next day (no offer to move us). We made do as we were very tired and just wanted food and bed. Went downstairs after showers only to find that Rosie's was closed for a Xmas party so we went up to the MacDonalds just up on the corner (also a Subway around the corner and a 7/11 across the street. The hotel has their own grocery store as well). The next day when we got back from sightseeing the shower STILL didn't work. Different person working the front desk, this woman was actually helpful so she offered to move us. We got a room on the same floor, much nicer as it wasn't a corner room so there was more space. You still had to move furniture to get the bed to come out though. The kitchenette is good for using the fridge, and if you want cereal for breakfast, but in a room that obviously sleeps more than two, there's only two place settings and a frypan, and a couple of bits of cutlery. Had to scrub the frypan before using it (also washed cutlery since I wasn't sure it was clean) so I wouldn't recommend cooking here, we only attempted it once. The rooms were cleaned daily, but they only provide shampoo (no conditioner) and some lotion, and it's all in little sachets, which aren't very big. Internet charge was ridiculous so we used the little internet place right next door, their rates were much better. Overall I was very disappointed, and would not stay here again, I don't know if they've changed management since we stayed last, but the service was much better the last time. Find some place else.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: Momma_K_in_VA
Reviews.Content: We booked thru RCI for mid-August. Vancouver is wonderful but the hotel was a major disappointment. The RCI staff was not helpful when I could not immediately locate my reservation number. Rather than call RCI, the clerk sent me to another timeshare’s office insisting I was not with RCI (16 yr. member). When we finally got to our tiny suite (our bigger suite was given to a person with similar name) we found the A/C didn’t work properly and the room, which received full sun all day, was hot even at 3 a.m. RCI had no fans to lend us & its staff was unable to get the unit to work correctly. We had to leave the door open most of the night to get some ventilation. No other units were available so we had to stick it out. As for the suite – the bedroom was ample but the living room/kitchen was very small & didn’t accommodate the furniture. In order to open the sofa bed, we had to stack the chairs on the table & move some to the bedroom. The linens & blankets did not appear to be clean – disgusting! The hotel was within walking distance of several first-rate restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but dim”
Reviews.Author: gauly
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel was OK and the price was one of the cheapest we could find in Vancouver for two seperate rooms (so that we didn't have to share with our two small children). The location was excellent. We had a great view of the Vancouver Public Library across the road and could even see a little bit of the mountains in the distance. It was in easy walking distance from the main downtown area and we walked up to Stanley Park from here (though that is a couple of kilometres away). The pool was clean but cold and there was also a hot tub. There was also a free breakfast but personally I'm not that keen on muffins which was all there was on offer. The hotel restaurant was reasonable. The staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and there were two tellys (one in the living area and one in the bedroom). Now for the minus points. My main complaint would be that the living area had no windows (they were in the bedroom) so the whole suite was rather dim. The suite was also rather small. We booked a Family King which said on expedia that it slept up to 6 if you requested the bunk beds. We didn't request bunk beds, but I thought we would get some extra space. Instead we got a king sized bed in the bedroom, a sofa bed in the lounge and definitely no room for more beds than that. The kitchenette was a waste of space since the only stuff provided was cuttlery and two bowls so you couldn't cook there. The charge for wireless internet was extortionate so we went without. I might stay here again if I could get a special offer price like we did this time, but at full price I would try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Looks better on paper”
Reviews.Author: poppyfield123
Reviews.Content: We (3 friends and I) chose to stay at the Rosedale because we wanted to all share one place to cut down on costs (rather than 2 twin hotel rooms) but still having loads of space and good service. We chose a 2-bedroom suite. The concierge and reception staff were all excellent - very helpful and friendly. The suite was a decent size for 4 people and was very clean but the bedrooms had all the windows so the living area had no natural light apart from the little bit that came through if the bedroom doors were left open. This was fine for us because we were out early and back late but if you needed to be in the suite for any longer it would probably get very depressing. Another problem was with the sofa-bed. We'd chosen the 2-bedroom specifically because it had 4 separate beds (including the sofa-bed in the living area) but none of us could sleep on the sofa-bed because of the awful noise the fridge made only a couple of feet from the bed so 2 of us ended up sharing a bed in the double room. Rosedale really need to spend a night on that sofa then rethink they're 'sleeps 6' statement about the 2-bedroom. I don't think there would be enough room for 6 people in there anyway - there was room for 4 but only just. Another thing as that, although this may sound like the perfect place for a family of four with the double and twin rooms, I wouldn't recommend the restaurant if you have kids with you. One of us was under 19 at the time and looked it. The law is the law so we were expecting to be put as far away from the bar as possible but thought it would be fine as it's meant to be a 'family restaurant'. Well they obviously don't mean families with children! We were put in the furthest corner away from all other human contact and right next to the kitchens where we couldn't even see the light of day never mind the bar. Then the wait-staff proceed to treat us like some sort of a disease. To add insult to injury the food turned out to not only be over-priced but awful. I haven't had that bad a burger in a long time and I sometimes go to Burger King (no offense to Burger King but when you've only paid £1.99 for it you don't expect it to be gourmet). It wasn't located in a BAD area as bad areas of cities go but we (4 young women) didn't feel comfortable walking back at night the last few blocks after you get out of the busy area of Robson Street (east of Granville Street-ish). The kitchenette was also very definitely an 'ette'. If you just need it for breakfast like we did then it's fine but not for any bigger meals. The hotel was clean and fine for a couple of nights stay if you're travelling with a guy but I wouldn't recommend it for single or female-only travellers or if you're looking for self-catering. The best thing about this hotel are they're reception and concierge staff - some of the best there are! Overall this hotel may look like the best of all worlds but don't be fooled.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: dkels
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed at the Rosedale on Robson for our honeymoon in August. Fell in love with Vancouver straight away and the hotel was perfectly situated for getting around on foot. Only a short walk to the harbour, the beaches and Robson street (for great shopping). Stanley Park is also within walking distance although sometimes we preferred to take taxis which are always waiting outside the hotel and relatively cheap. The hotel itself was perfect- the room was very clean and airy, with all the facilities we needed. The televisions and latest hotel movies were great for getting over jet lag. The staff were very friendly and helpful, with housekeeping every day- they even washed up our cutlery which was unexpected! The spa and sauna and steam room was perfect for relaxing the legs after a day of walking. The only slight disappointment was the swimming pool which was a little small. The thing we miss the most is Rosie's Diner. We loved this place as all the staff were so friendly and really made us feel at home. The food was great and reasonably priced. We are already planning a return visit for next summer as we enjoyed it so much. Would definately recommend it for other couples.

Reviews.Title: “Theft in the room!”
Reviews.Author: mmmyyy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from 10th to 13th september. my mother came to see me from Japan, so I chose this hotel because I thought it must be a good hotel for her to make good memory. but at the second day, we noticed our stuffs in our bags were stoled by somebody after coming back to the room...I talked to the hotel staff, but what they said is they could not find the truth. the persons who entered the room are us and the house keeper,so I doubt that the house keeper did something in our room when we were out. but they told us that she's been working for 10 years and very reliable. I of couse dont know her and believe that. what they did for us at the end is giving us back a little amount of money with which I cannot buy some replacements for our loss. I never use this hotel and never recommend to stay there to my friends. maybe they might think we cannot complain so much because we cannot speak English fluently. that 's mean....do you think that is a nice attitude for the customers as the hotel in the popular city, vancouver?

Reviews.Title: “Suite success”
Reviews.Author: Strongmans
Reviews.Content: Returned home yesterday having spent 12 nights @ Rosedale. The suite was ideal for us as the separate bedroom and living room, although not huge, gave us enough breathing space. Our children were able to watch tv in the bedroom whilst we chilled out in the living room. You may have to ask housekeeping for additional towels and cutlery etc if there are 4 of you but in fairness they were provided very quickly. The suite was clean and as we aked for non smoking it smelled fresh and airy at all times. Rosie's diner downstairs is very convenient and good value for both breakfast and evening meals . The pool is slightly small, but with the spa pool and 2 saunas made a relaxing end to each day. One tip is to buy books of 10 bus tickets at 7/11 shop opposite as the tickets are easier than paying every time you use a bus. The no 15 service that stops at the Library opposite gets you into downtown quickly with links to other destinations (e.g Stanley Park -no 19). The free coffee/muffins was handy, but it'll take a while for us to be able to look at a muffin again!! The staff were friendly and helpful. Would stay here again which is the best testimony we can give.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: might
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and child and apart from the speed of the lifts making me feel sick we all really enjoyed our stay. Didn't have much to bother the staff for and everything seemed clean and comfortable. I'd stay there again. Good value

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 43iiainbw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rosedale at the end of July. The hotel is well positioned and the suites are good for families. The pool is on the small size for a hotel of this size. Saying that if we were to go back to Vancouver we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Travelling-Scots
Reviews.Content: Excellent suite hotel at the end of downtown Robson Street. The location was perfect as bars and restaurants were thinning out here so there wasn't the noise and traffic issue on the main part of the street. The kitchen had a full size cooker, microwave and fridge, sofa and armchair. The bedroom was large and nicely decorated. The reception staff were very pleasant. The onsite restaurant Rosie's was very good and reasonably priced which was a pleasant surprise as these are usually overpriced and mediocre. Although at the opposite end from Stanley Park, the hotel is only a few minutes walk from transport to all points of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Underqualified staff at the Rosedale”
Reviews.Author: fiveinthefamily
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed for one night Canada Day. The room was not ready at check in. They were very late in getting it ready and had a "too bad, so sad" attitude about it. When we finally got to the room, the carpets were not vacumed. Once again, no apologies when I phoned down to get that straightened out. The attitude of the people that work there needs improvement. Otherwise, the suites are small and just OK. Even though they accommodate a family well, I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: tomnvivi
Reviews.Content: Room was dated but clean - 2 King sized beds, separate kitchenette and lounge - 2 TV's playstation etc., Staff were very helpful. Excellent location on Robson. Don't put your alarm clock on for the complimentary muffins and coffee! Get the ferry over to Granville Island its worth it. Take a trip on the Panoramic Sea Plane - fantastic views.

Reviews.Title: “Ab Fab!”
Reviews.Author: kelad
Reviews.Content: Whats not to love, My partner and I stayed at the Rosedale from April 19th-22nd. Location, Location, Location, just a few minutes walk into the main shopping area and to the local market "Urbane Fair" which had fantastic local food! The king size bed was very comfy and the separate lounge room was a bonus. Cable tv in both bedroom and lounge. Having a small kichen was ideal enabling us to eat in for a change. As mentioned by a previous reviewer the dishes were not done by housekeeping, but we felt that was a minor issue. We did not even need to go out for breakfast, as there were complimentary scones and muffins in the recreation area. The laundry was a saviour as we had been travelling for a few weeks Close to transport, both train and bus, but we hired a car to go to Grouse mountain and Capilano suspension bridge. (Check the reverse side of your ticket if going to both as there is a discount coupon for entry) Would recommend this hotel to friends great value for money!

HotelInfo.Name: Rosedale on Robson
HotelInfo.Address: 838 Hamilton St., Vancouver, British Columbia V6B 6A2, Canada
